"Hmph!" Sophia lifted her head proudly, pretending not to care, but her little tail wagged happily behind her.
"The driver is old, though not broken. I suggest replacing it," Sophia said.
"Alright, take it out," Arix agreed immediately.
Then, Sophia pointed out a few more hidden places, and Arix took them apart one by one.
When Sophia finally stopped talking, Arix breathed a sigh of relief. She hadn’t realized she missed so many places.
If Arix scored 90, Sophia added 10 more points.
That was impressive.
Now Arix started to take Sophia’s words seriously. Sophia might not be able to build a mecha, but her understanding of them was no less than Arix’s.
Arix mainly relied on Old Arix’s memories and her own recent studies about mechas.
But now it seemed Sophia, who had never actually worked with mechas, was better.
It was like Sophia had a natural talent for mechas.
Arix looked at Sophia with increasing excitement, scheming in her mind.
Sophia felt a chill for no reason. Then she noticed Arix watching her. Sophia nervously swallowed and asked, "Why are you looking at me?"
Arix quickly changed her eager expression to a harmless smile. "I just think you’re really amazing, Sophia. There are so many things I don’t understand. Would you mind teach me?"
Arix put on a scared-to-be-rejected face, looking at Sophia with a pitiful expression. She even blinked her eyes, like a teenager’s rough attempt to hit on a guy in a bar.
Sophia rolled her eyes and cringed a bit. Unable to bear it, she quickly said, "I’ll teach you, just act normal, or I’ll puke."
With that, Sophia gagged a bit.
Arix secretly rolled her eyes and huffed, silently accusing Sophia for not recognizing her charm.
Despite her thoughts, Arix showed a deeply moved expression and sweetly added, "Sophia, you’re the best! I like you the most, mwah..."
"If you keep talking, I won’t teach you anymore!" Sophia said fiercely, but her tail was wagging like a happy fan, and even her fluffy face had a shy blush.
Arix raised her eyebrows, understanding but not commenting on it, and obediently replied, "Okay, I won’t say anymore."
"Hmph!" Sophia snorted coldly.
Then she started carefully guiding Arix on installing the new components on the mecha. For some parts that were missing, Arix even got them from her Space Button and installed them.
They worked busily the whole afternoon. When the last part was in place, Arix applied a layer of anti-radiation paint to the mecha. Only then was the repair officially finished.

chapters.title: Chapter 77: Kidnapping
chapters.content:
Chapter 77: Kidnapping
After cleaning up everything, Arix and the three little tiger cubs stood in a line in front of the mecha, their four pairs of eyes simultaneously looking at the newly repaired mecha. They all exclaimed in awe.
"Wow! This big guy is so cool!" Cupid exclaimed excitedly.
"It’s just okay," Sophia said with a disdainful look, but her eyes showed a hint of satisfaction.
"Arix and Sophia are amazing. You both did a great job!" Vita praised.
Arix and Sophia blushed a little at the compliment, their smiles growing wide.
After a moment, Arix suggested, "Let’s take a few pictures together. It’s our first repaired mecha, and it would be a shame not to capture this moment."
"Yes! Happy, happy!" Cupid was the first to agree, excitedly circling the three of them.
Sophia, for once, didn’t say anything sarcastic and nodded.
"I’ll choose the angles. Arix, give me your opticomputer," Vita said indulgently, looking at the three of them. He took the opticomputer from Arix and used his psychic power to make it float in the air.
Following Vita’s directions, Arix stood a bit away from the mecha in the middle, holding Vita, Sophia, and Cupid in her arms. They all smiled for the picture.
They took photos in various spots: on the mecha’s shoulder, in its palm, in the crook of its arm, and finally inside the mecha’s control cabin, finishing with one last group photo.
Arix took back the opticomputer and opened the gallery, happily looking through the photos with the three little ones.
"Cupid, don’t move around so much next time. You made this photo blurry," Sophia complained when she saw a slightly blurred Cupid in one picture.
"Got it. I won’t move next time," Cupid replied, looking a bit sad.
"It’s okay, it’s just one photo. The others are great," Vita said, lifting his paw to rub Cupid’s little head.
Arix didn’t say anything, just patted Cupid’s head to show comfort.
Arix wouldn’t get involved in the little ones’ affairs. After all, each of them was her precious cub. She loved them all equally and couldn’t bear to favor one over the other.
Fortunately, Vita had the nature of an elder, and he could help Arix take care of Cupid and Sophia. Without Vita, just thinking about handling these sweet troubles made Arix feel overwhelmed.
’Ah! Love Vita!’
Arix thought, feeling grateful.
After looking at the photos, Arix was ready to leave. She sent Vita and the others back to her psychic world to rest. Alone, Arix walked out of the repair room and closed the door behind her.
She wanted to thank the old man again but couldn’t find him anywhere.
Not long after she stepped out of the gate of the department, a man and a woman grabbed her. One of them covered her mouth, and the other wrapped his arms around her waist and carried her away.
Suddenly kidnapped, Arix was confused and didn’t react at first. Once she calmed down a bit, she saw that the people who kidnapped her were Cantet and Rhea. A bad feeling rose in Arix’s heart.
’Are they here for revenge? Should I resist when they start beating her?’
The kidnapping process was very short. In less than 30 seconds, Cantet and Rhea brought Arix to a secluded corner.
"What do you want?" Arix asked, looking at them warily. She also prepared Cupid in her psychic world for a fight.
Cantet and Rhea exchanged a glance. Then, they were about to take something out of the Space Button.
Arix grew more and more nervous, thinking they might take out guns or clubs to beat her. The tension was high.
Just as Cupid was about to come out, Arix saw two hands holding gifts appear in front of her.
’Gifts?’
Both Cupid and Arix were stunned.
Arix looked cautiously at Cantet and Rhea. Cantet was the one she had accidentally hurt, and Rhea was the one she had fought. Both of them ended in the hospital because of her.
Arix checked their faces again. Yes, it was definitely them.
So, they couldn’t possibly be here to give her gifts. They were more likely here to finish her off.
’Damn it, it’s a trap! Run!’
Just as Arix was about to turn and run, Cantet and Rhea grabbed her shoulders from both sides.
Arix closed her eyes in resignation. Then she turned to them and said, "What do you want? I won’t resist, okay? Just do what you want quickly. Have some mercy and don’t give me sufferings."
Cantet and Rhea looked at Arix in confusion. Rhea frowned and asked, "I think there are some misunderstandings here. We came to apologize."
"Apologize?" Arix almost looked at them with horror, wondering if they were crazy.
’Am I dreaming, or are these two crazy, or the world has just gone crazy as I expected?’
She had both of them end up in the hospital, and they came to apologize to her.
No matter how shocked Arix felt inside, she kept a calm expression, quietly watching them.
Perhaps the awkward silence made Cantet and Rhea feel uneasy. The latter coughed and decided to speak quickly.
"I shouldn’t have brought my own selfish motives and invaded your psychic world. Even though your psychic power retaliated against me, I still need to say, I’m sorry."
Arix’s expression changed. She asked silently in her mind, "Vita, is he telling the truth?"
"Yes, he tried to hypnotize you to get information, so I had Cupid teach him a lesson," Vita, usually kind-hearted, held a grudge this time.
Arix was shocked to realize she had narrowly avoided a great danger.
She wasn’t even from this interstellar world. If Cantet had discovered her true identity, her fate would have been grim.
She had thought Cantet’s psychic power backlash was because she forgot to mention her psychic power level. It turned out that he was actually trying to invade her psychic world.
Infuriating, she said to Vita, "Next time we meet someone like this, make sure they stay in hospital for at least six months!"
"Got it!" Vita, sharing the anger, clenched her tiny fists.
Having understood the reason, Arix showed no kindness to Cantet but still accepted the gift. She then gave a sarcastic, sweet smile. "Captain Cantet, do you want to try again next time? The consequence isn’t severe; just another six month in the hospital."
Cantet shivered and hid behind his sister, Rhea. He had had enough of hospital food.
Seeing Cantet scared enough to hide behind Rhea calmed Arix’s anger a bit. She turned her attention to Rhea, thinking what kind of apology she was going to offer.
Rhea, trying to maintain her cool demeanor, nearly lost it under Arix’s gaze. She awkwardly coughed and said, "Um, Cantet is actually my brother. I thought you were hurting him on purpose, so I was harsh during the assessment. Sorry, here’s my gift. Please forgive me."
Arix was speechless.
This truth was worse than not knowing. At least then, she wouldn’t feel so frustrated. The guilty was eating away from her, and she almost lost her dinner appetite. Now, she felt like something was stuck in her throat, making it impossible to swallow her anger.
However, Arix naturally had a soft spot for girls like herself. She sighed helplessly and took Rhea’s gift. Then she stared at the two and said, "Apologies accepted, but I have one finally request."
"Say it, we’ll definitely do it!" Cantet and Rhea looked at Arix with determined eyes, eager to show their sincerity.
Arix originally wanted to say, "Just stay away from me in the future." But seeing their eager faces, she couldn’t bring herself to say it. Finally, she sighed and rubbed her forehead.
"You two are my brother’s comrades. Just take care of him should anything happens," she said.
"No problem, that’s easy. Leave it to us," Rhea quickly agreed, her voice full of enthusiasm.
Cantet, however, hesitated. In the end, he nodded silently, as if bearing a great burden. Taking care of his ’nemesis’ was a bitter pill to swallow. Just thinking about having to be nice to Kellan made him shudder.
But Arix didn’t know any of this. She genuinely believed that Cantet was a good friend of her brother. After all, Kellan had brought soup to Cantet when he was in the hospital. And Cantet had claimed to be friends with her brother.

chapters.title: Chapter 78: A Spy
chapters.content:
Chapter 78: A Spy
It was getting late.
Arix checked the time on the opticomputer. It was almost 6 PM. Thinking about catching the excitement on the interstellarnet later, Arix said goodbye to Cantet and his sister.
Back at her temporary residence, Arix released Cupid and the others from her psychic world. Arix took a shower first. Then she lay back on the bed with the three little ones, watching the holographic live stream projected by the opticomputer.
At this moment, the Alliance’s official live stream was on, but it hadn’t started yet. In the live stream room, besides the background wall with the Alliance’s national emblem, there was only a simple wooden table with five potions of various colors on it. There were no introductions around the potions.
The audience in the live stream could only guess. Then they posted all kinds of strange ideas on the public screen.
SnooLover42: "I suspect these are gene upgrade potions. They’ve been researching this for decades, so it’s about time."
CosmicWanderer: "Even if the gene upgrade potion is out, I wouldn’t use it. Novelists have written about meddling with human genes, causing people to develop mental disorders as adults. Natural babies are the best."
MemeMachine3000: "You’ve read too many novels. Why not say the potion will turn you into a zombie immediately?"
EightBalls: "Exactly. This is an official account. They wouldn’t dare to show the potions if they weren’t safe."
...
Arix watched the heated discussion on the public screen and posted a message.
MechaMonster: "Could it be a Psychic Healer?"
As soon as Arix said this, the public screen went silent for a moment. Then it exploded with messages.
DeepSpaceNineFan: "I didn’t want to join the conversation, but you guys are getting too ridiculous. A Psychic Healer? Everyone knows terminal psychic power diseases can’t be cured, at least not by potions."
SnooLover42: "MechaMonster, I thought I had a wild imagination, but you beat me. Respect."
MemeMachine3000: "Even my grandfather, who’s close to passing away, asked if a Psychic Healer was available today."
CosmicWanderer: "It’s never coming out. If it does, I’ll pee standing on my head."
MechaMonster: "I took a screenshot. Keep your word."
CosmicWanderer: "The Alliance can never make it!!"
Arix raised an eyebrow, feeling something was off, and sent another message.
MechaMonster: "Galactic beans ground fine and fair—"
This sentence was from a well-known Alliance advertisement. Almost every citizen could finish it with, "A cosmic espresso fills the air."
Anyone who couldn’t complete the sentence would have a very suspicious identity.
CosmicWanderer: "What beans? Are you saying the potion bottles have beans?"
The chat went silent again for a moment. Then the viewers in the live stream became even more excited.
SnooLover42: "Caught a little spy. I’ve already notified the police. You’re welcome."
hail_our_Alliance: "Can’t even finish our Alliance’s slogan. Definitely a spy."
Olivetree: "So quiet for so long. Feeling guilty?"
...
Meanwhile, the top hacker spy, known as CosmicWanderer, who had been lurking in the Alliance for a long time, was arrested by the police on charges of espionage.
He still couldn’t accept the fact that he had been exposed as he struggled and denied, "You’ve got the wrong person! I’m not a spy!"
The police officer sneered, "Galactic beans ground fine and fair—"
"What...?" CosmicWanderer was utterly confused.
"You don’t even know this? And you dare claim you’re from the Alliance? Reflect on this in prison." Seeing the criminal unable to respond, the interstellar police officer spoke coldly, more convinced of his guilt.
"You have no evidence. Why are you arresting me? I’ll sue you," CosmicWanderer glared at the police officer, threateningly.
"Huh! Do you think we’d arrest you without evidence?" The interstellar police officer laughed mockingly.
He then opened the opticomputer and displayed photos of the secret documents that CosmicWanderer had transmitted outside the Alliance.
CosmicWanderer’s eyes trembled as he looked at the evidence. Finally, he lowered his head, silent, allowing the police to take him away.
Back in the live stream room, after the spy was arrested, the police posted an official announcement.
CosmicWanderer was a spy, and he had been arrested and put in custody.
This news left Arix stunned. She had only felt a bit suspicious, never expecting to accidentally catch a real spy.
At that moment, Arix’s feelings matched her comment on the screen.
MechaMonster: "...."
SnooLover42: "Amazing, we really caught a spy."
friedinsectoid: "For some reason, I feel sorry for him
hail_our_Alliance: "You sympathize with the spy? I think I have reason to doubt you now. So please complete my sentence: Galactic beans ground fine and fair—?"
friedinsectoid: "A cosmic espresso fills the air."
hail_our_Alliance: "Suspicion canceled, confirmed you’re an ally!"
...
Arix watched the live stream’s sudden spy-hunting craze, feeling a bit awkward. She seemed to have set the stream’s tone off course.
Fortunately, it was finally 7 PM. In the live stream, two people in white lab coats and five patients in hospital gowns appeared.
Arix recognized the two in white lab coats; they were from the Fifth Legion research base. The older one was called Noland, and the younger one was Hinddle.
"Hello everyone, welcome to the official channel of the Alliance. Today, I bring you great news: the Psychic Healer has finally been successfully developed!!" Noland said excitedly, looking directly at the live stream camera.
The live stream audience went wild, expressing disbelief, but since it was an official broadcast, the public chat fell silent.
Some viewers, once they processed the news, immediately rushed to call their family and friends to watch the live stream together. Others started sobbing uncontrollably, crying for themselves and for their friends and family.
There were also spies from other countries among the viewers, who, upon hearing the news, real or not, immediately reported it back to their own countries.
The entire Alliance—no, the entire galaxy... All the countries, large and small, now focused all their attention on the Alliance. They were eager to see how the Alliance had addressed the difficult that had been haunting this world for thousands of years.

chapters.title: Chapter 79: Arix’s Decision
chapters.content:
Chapter 79: Arix’s Decision
In the official livestream of the Alliance...
Unlike the excited viewers, Noland felt very calm now.
When their military research institute first learned that there was hope for the Psychic Healer, their cheers almost blew the roof off the building.
Thinking of this, Noland smiled. Then he stopped keeping everyone in suspense. He looked at the livestream camera with bright eyes, and said, "I believe everyone is as excited as I am, so I won’t waste any more time. Let me introduce these five potions."
Noland picked up the first potion and displayed it in a hologram in the livestream. While showing it, he said, "The first potion is for treating psychic power poisoning. To show the effect of the potion, we invited five patients with mental illnesses today. The first one is a patient with psychic power poisoning. This is the patient’s medical report. Everyone can click to view it."
After Noland finished speaking, a medical report appeared in the livestream. Arix, curious, also clicked to take a look.
Military Research Institute Medical Report
Patient Name: Dan Kruse
Title: Ensign, the Fifth Legion
Examination Results
Body: Fractured lower leg has healed, heart and lungs replaced with cloned organs. Long-term rest recommended.
Brain: Due to complications, brain nerves and blood vessels are withered and ruptured.
Psychic Power Examination: Due to insect bio-poison, psychic power is exhausted and polluted, with a possible future rampage. Treatment is advised, and it should be done as soon as possible.
Before the livestream, this medical report would have been a death sentence. But now, there is hope for a cure. And it’s officially certified. Thinking of this, the viewers became more and more eager for what was to come, and some impatient viewers started urging in the chat.
Noland smiled and waited until the time was right before finally speaking, "Everyone has seen the medical report. Now we will let Ensign Kruse drink the potion and see the effect. Will it be despair or a miracle? Let’s see."
After speaking, Noland aimed the scanner at Kruse until the screen showed the same medical data as Kruse’s. Then he handed the potion to the eager Ensign Kruse.
Kruse was not in good shape. Since learning about his psychic power poisoning, he refused to rest properly. Being in despair for a long time made him look as terrible as an addict.
At this moment, his eyes were sunken, and his dry, twig-like hands eagerly grabbed the potion. He opened the cap and gulped it down in one go.
Because he drank too quickly, he choked, but he was afraid of spitting it out, so he covered his mouth tightly with both hands, his face turning red.
The viewers in the livestream didn’t laugh or look down on Kruse, at all.
They couldn’t imagine what it was like to experience such despair, and they watched in respectful silence.
Those who had truly experienced despair could empathize with Kruse. They knew that if they were in his place, they might look even worse.
Even though the livestream ran at a normal speed, the viewers felt like time was dragging on.
The only comfort was that Ensign Kruse was now sitting calmly in his chair, with a hint of contentment on his face, and he finally fell asleep comfortably.
Everyone silently agreed not to disturb him and kept their eyes on the data on the monitor.
The data increased slowly, but it felt like heavy hammers striking their chests, making them blush and breathe heavily with excitement.
When Kruse’s psychic power data finally showed he was healthy, the viewers went wild, their joyful cheers echoing everywhere.
Even spies from other counties cheered when they saw the results. However, they were soon reminded by their companions, leading to embarrassed coughs and awkward silence. Deep down, they were still happy because they had family and friends who were waiting in despair, too.
The livestream didn’t last long, only two hours in total, but it caused a shockwave throughout the Alliance and all the nations across the galaxy, like a nuclear bomb.
The Alliance’s Foreign Affairs phone lines were flooded with calls from other countries, and they all wanted to buy the Psychic Healer. The Alliance responded that they would make the formula public, but the potion would only be available for purchase to non-Alliance countries after a month.
When Arix saw this news, she exclaimed, "Brilliant!"
Making the formula public had pros and cons. The downside was that the Alliance wouldn’t get the biggest profit. However, the upsides were greater: it would bring a good reputation to the Alliance and allow them to escape being a target.
As the developer of the potion, Arix would no longer be the focus of attention. After all, if the formula was widely available, there wouldn’t be much interest in targeting her.
The key point was that the potion required Arix Crystal as an ingredient, and only Arix had it, which meant she had significant control over the industry.
At the moment, Arix was busy negotiating a contract with Quillan, who had suddenly shown up. The agreement was that she would produce the Arix Crystal, and the Alliance would give her 10% of the profits from selling it.
Arix was very tempted by the offer, but she decided to change her share of the profits from 10% to 5%.
"You lowered it down? Why?" Quillan was stunned. He had never seen anyone turn down money like this before.
"Sir, I know many people are fighting to protect me, so I want the 5% profit to go to those protecting me and those who have been burdened because of me."
Lately, Arix had often seen on the interstellarnet that the Fifth Legion frequently faced insectoid invasions. She couldn’t help but think this was related to her, given her past abduction by the insectoids.
Quillan looked deeply at the young girl before him and then saluted her, his gaze firm and solemn. "I will convey your wishes to the president. Also, protecting you is their duty, so please don’t feel burdened."
Arix smiled but said nothing. After signing all the contracts, she politely saw the busy Quillan off.
As she watched Quillan walk away, Arix yawned sleepily. Remembering that she had to return to the training base early the next day, Arix bid goodnight to Cupid and the others before lying down and going to sleep.

chapters.title: Chapter 80: A Weak Arix
chapters.content:
Chapter 80: A Weak Arix
The next morning, Arix arrived at the training base very early. She first went to the administrative office to hand in her opticomputer. Then she returned to her dormitory.
When she opened the door and walked in, she found that her roommates were already awake. They all looked surprised when they saw Arix.
"Hey! Our missing roommate has finally come back!" Rei saw Arix and immediately showed a big smile, exclaiming exaggeratedly.
Leyla and Calista rushed over, happily hugging Arix’s arms on both sides.
"Arix, where have you been these past ten days?" Calista, now bolder after getting to know everyone, hugged Arix’s arm and asked sweetly.
"Yeah, I was so jealous of you. You don’t know how hard it has been for us at the training base. Look, my hands have become rough, and my skin has darkened," Leyla said, sounding very pitiful.
She showed her hands to Arix.
"The Fifth Legion needed potions, so I went to help for a while. Oh, and I brought you gifts," Arix explained quickly, not knowing what else to say. Then she changed the topic.
"Wow, what gifts?" Rei got excited at the mention of gifts and quickly ran over to Arix, asking curiously.
"Don’t worry, everyone gets something." Arix took out a bunch of potions from her Space Button.
She started distributing the potions and gave detailed instructions. "Maya, Rei, these are special Star-Class forging potions to repair your body. Leyla, I know you love beauty, so here’s a skin lotion for you to apply before bed. Lilou, I didn’t know what you’d like, so I got you a Star-Class healing potion. And Qingqing, this is a mecha model that someone in my family loves. It’s for you."
Arix winked at Calista with a playful smile.
Calista blushed, but she quickly took the mecha model from Arix’s hand.
Maya and the others were very touched by Arix’s thoughtful gifts. They each took out their most precious items from their Space Buttons and handed them to Arix.
"Arix, I got this by accident. I don’t know what it is, but it’s a material for making mechas. I hope you don’t mind," Rei said, handing Arix a box of something that looked like a mix of metal and liquid.
Rei didn’t recognize it, but Arix did. The material was called mithril. It could enhance the flexibility of mecha joints. It wasn’t very expensive but was just what Arix needed. She was so happy about the gift.
"Thank you, Rei, I love it," Arix said, taking it happily.
"Yeah! I love mine too," Rei said, smiling as she looked at her potion.
Maya’s situation was the worst among them. In her Space Button, there was nothing precious, only a few hometown snacks that were decent enough to give as gifts.
Feeling a bit embarrassed, she said, "Arix, I don’t have any fancy gifts for you. Just some special snacks my parents prepared. I hope you like them."
Arix saw Maya’s embarrassment but genuinely liked the gift. She immediately encouraged her with a bright smile, "Thank you, Maya. I was just wondering what to bring my parents as a gift, and now I have something. I’ll share these with them and I’m sure they’ll like it."
Warmth filled Maya’s heart, and she smiled back at Arix.
"Arix, look at my gift!" Leyla, finally getting her turn, said with a mischievous grin.
Arix’s eyelid twitched as she took the gift and opened it. Inside was a pink princess dress with a big bow on the chest, almost making Arix lose her composure.
Quickly closing the lid, Arix forced a smile, trying to hide her amazement, "Thank you, I really... like it."
"If you like it, I have many more at home... When school starts, I’ll bring a few more sets for you and the other girls," Leyla said. She was excited by Arix’s forced compliment, even wanting to offer dresses for the others too.
Arix and all the other one chuckled.
Fortunately, the gifts from Lilou and Calista were normal mecha materials, giving Arix a sense of relief. She never thought receiving gifts could give her such anxiety.
The joyful time was short-lived. Soon, Arix and the others checked the time and left the dormitory, heading to the comprehensive training ground to start their physical power training class.
The physical power training was the same as always: wearing weight rings and running ten kilometers.
What surprised Arix was that her classmates and instructors didn’t seem surprised at her sudden return. They seemed quite used to it.
The students were genuinely accustomed to it since Arix trained less often than they had weekends. They all thought Arix disappeared occasionally due to health issues.
The instructors, knowing the real situation, turned a blind eye.
Two days passed, peacefully.
On the second day after training ended, the instructor didn’t dismiss the team as usual.
Instead, he looked at all the students with a serious expression and said, "The training period is almost over. For the last week, the school and training base have decided to hold a one-week-long wilderness survival competition. Unlike previous competitions, this one could be life-threatening. Participation is voluntary. If anyone does not wish to participate, you can raise your hand now to withdraw. However, withdrawing means you are no longer eligible to enter the military academy. If you want to withdraw, raise your hand now."
Ortiz looked around at the students of the Hecaris Military Academy. Seeing no one raise their hand, he continued, "Good, you are all very brave. But I also hope you do not push yourselves too hard. If you change your mind before the competition starts tomorrow, you can come to me privately. The competition starts tomorrow at 9 AM. You need to gather at the comprehensive training ground by 8 AM. Any questions?"
"No, sir!" the students of the Hecaris Military Academy responded loudly.
"Alright, you’re dismissed," Ortiz said. Then he turned and left with Virtanen and the others, seemingly busy preparing for tomorrow’s competition.

chapters.title: Chapter 81: An Incident Before The Competition
chapters.content:
Chapter 81: An Incident Before The Competition
At the Mecha Department...
Since yesterday, when Bernanke saw the mecha that seemed to be repaired by a helper, he had come up with an idea.
After hesitating for two days, Bernanke went to the director’s office to find Magen.
"Sir..." Bernanke hesitated, unsure how to start.
"Bernanke, what’s the matter?" Magen asked, seeing Bernanke’s uncertain expression.
"Well, sir, I was looking for an assistant, and I thought the helper you arranged for me the other day was pretty good. I was wondering if they could be my assistant. What do you think?" Bernanke finally said.
Magen thought for a moment and then said, "You mean her? But she’s not one of us. She can’t be your assistant, and she’s still a student."
"A student?!" Bernanke said, surprised.
"Yes, she’s a student in our Department of Mecha Manufacture," Magen added.
"Are students this skilled nowadays?" Bernanke thought of the mecha he saw repaired the other day and was amazed.
Magen raised an eyebrow, curious. "Is she really that good? I think she’s just a freshman."
Magen thought the girl had just cleaned the mecha well and thus earned Bernanke’s approval. He liked tidy kids too.
Thinking this, Magen nodded, feeling even better about the girl. He thought he might show her more advanced mechas next time.
"A freshman this year? That means she’s only in her teens. She can disassemble and replace broken parts on her own without making any mistakes. That’s really impressive," Bernanke praised, still surprised.
Hearing this, Magen suddenly realized something. He stared at Bernanke, almost speechless, "You mean she repaired a broken mecha by herself?"
"Yes. Didn’t you find the helper for me? Why do you seem to know less than I do?" Bernanke asked, puzzled.
Magen kept his mouth shut in silence.
In fact, he just randomly grabbed someone to clean the dirty mecha. This was also Bernanke’s fault for not putting the mecha away during his break, leaving it dirty in the repair room.
It seemed the Mecha Department needed a new rule: except during repair time, dirty mechas must stay in the Space Button.
The more Magen thought about it, the more annoyed he felt with Bernanke. He might be the first to be dealt with under this new rule.
"Sir..." Bernanke felt uneasy under Magen’s gaze. He swallowed nervously, and wondered what he had done wrong.
"No problem. Follow me and show me the mecha she repaired," Magen said, choosing to skip the topic for now, his tone dismissive.
He was very curious if the girl was really as good as Bernanke said. Magen led Bernanke to his own repair room and motioned for Bernanke to bring out the mecha.
Bernanke nodded and took out the Comet-Class mecha. The once battered and broken mecha now looked brand new, looking powerful and intimidating.
If Magen hadn’t seen the mecha before, he might not have recognized it. It was clear that Arix had put a lot of effort into the repair. Magen silently nodded in approval.
The mecha was clean and looked new—an extra point for that.
Then Magen thoroughly inspected the mecha inside and out, his admiration growing stronger. If 100 points was the maximum, Magen would give her 99!
The only thing he was dissatisfied with was that he found some parts in the mecha that he hadn’t provided. Although Arix had volunteered them, Magen didn’t feel right about taking advantage of a young girl.
Thinking this, Magen sent Bernanke away and used his opticomputer to check the records of visitors to the Mecha Department from the other day.
When he found Arix’s photo, his eyes lit up, and he opened the file.
Visitor Records of the Mecha Department:
- Name: Arix Kering
- Gender: Female
- Identity: Daughter of Admiral Thaddeus Kering
- Entry Pass: One-time
- Sponsor: Kellan Kering
After reading the file, Magen was surprised. He hadn’t expected her to be the granddaughter of an old friend.
Thinking of the sweet and well-behaved girl, Magen started to feel a bit jealous of Matis.
’How does that old rascal get all the good luck?’
The woman he once had a crush on married Matis instead, and even Matis’s children were exceptional. Now, Matis had a lovely granddaughter too.
For the first time in his life, the lonely Magen felt a bit empty and cold.
Magen sighed deeply, then he opened his opticomputer to contact someone he had labeled as "old hypocrite."
"Well, well, a rare guest! What brings you here?" Matis’s smiling face appeared on the 3D virtual screen.
From the moment he saw Matis, Magen’s expression soured, but he forced himself to hold back his dislike. "Arix, she’s your granddaughter, right?"
Matis raised his eyebrows in surprise and replied, "Yes, my little granddaughter. Why?"
"I want her to study mecha with me. Make it happen," Magen said bluntly.
Matis was speechless.
This wasn’t something he could just decide. Ever since Arix developed the Psychic Healer, more and more people had opposed her staying in the Mecha Department.
Recently, Matis had begun to have doubts himself. So when he heard Magen’s words, his expression finally turned serious. "Are you sure Arix is suitable for mecha?"
"Hey! Old hypocrite, what do you mean by that? Are you questioning Arix, or are you questioning me, a master of mecha?" Magen was furious, his eyes blazing as he glared at Matis.
"Ahem.. Why do you always come up with these nicknames? Anyway, this isn’t something that can be explained in just a few words. Many people are against Arix staying in the Department of Mecha Manufacture. If you can take Arix as an apprentice, it would actually be a good thing," Matis said, exasperated by the ongoing issue.
Lately, Matis had been stressed to the point of losing hair over this matter. Almost everyone who learned that Arix was in the Department of Mecha Manufacture gave him a look of reproach, as if saying,
’A child doesn’t know any better, but you, an adult, are encouraging this nonsense. A genius in potion-making, and you’re letting her waste time on forging mechas.’

chapters.title: Chapter 82: A Hard Choice
chapters.content:
Chapter 82: A Hard Choice
Matis really felt like he had no way to express his frustration.
Those stubborn old people from the potion association... when they couldn’t reach Arix, who was in training, they blamed Matis, as he was the head of the Kering family.
They bombarded him with texts every ten minutes and video calls every hour for two days straight. He was so annoyed that he wanted to go and bombard the potion association, and with his real guns and cannons!
Magen didn’t care if Matis was having a hard time. Seeing that Matis didn’t object, Magen’s face softened a bit. He even patiently explained, "Your granddaughter has a great talent for mecha. If she is trained well, I bet you she’ll achieve a lot."
"Can she become a master?" Matis asked casually.
But Magen was speechless. ’The girl was just a toddler in this field, yet Matis is already thinking about making her fly. Does he really trust his granddaughter this much, or is he just a fool?’
It was like a teacher saying a student had good talent, and the parent immediately asking if the student could get into Harvard.
"Do you know what you’re saying?" Magen said calmly at first, but then he burst out, "Do you think becoming a master is that easy? It takes more than hopes and expectations, okay?"
Matis was scolded harshly. He rubbed his nose, feeling wronged, and said, "Magen, I didn’t mean that. I meant that if Arix doesn’t have the potential to become a master in mecha, she might not be able to study mecha peacefully in the Department of Mecha Manufacture."
"What do you mean by that?" Magen’s frown deepened. He felt like Matis was hinting at something.
"Many people are against Arix staying in the Department of Mecha Manufacture. They want her to switch majors and focus on potion studies," Matis explained openly.
After all, if Magen became her mecha teacher in the future, he would eventually understand the headache.
"So what? Your granddaughter loves mecha. Are you going to stop her from studying it because of what others say?" Magen looked at Matis with a disgusted expression.
"Magen, you don’t realize how serious this is. Do you know the most famous psychic power healing potion recently?" Matis asked.
"Yes, I know. So what does that have to do with your granddaughter? Are you going to tell me that she developed it?" Magen rolled his eyes sarcastically.
Matis had expected Magen’s reaction. After all, the truth was so unbelievable that nobody with basic chemistry knowledge would believe it easily.
With a helpless sigh, Matis said, "The Psychic Healer was developed by Arix. So now the potion association might force Arix to switch majors when the school year starts."
"Really? You’re not lying to me?" Magen asked in shock and disbelief.
Matis nodded seriously. He wouldn’t joke about something so serious.
Magen’s frown deepened. He didn’t expect the information to be so overwhelming that it almost made him feel like his back was giving out.
He couldn’t believe that a fifteen-year-old girl had developed the psychic power healing potion. This potion wasn’t just an ordinary one; it was a lifesaver for countless people!
Now, it wasn’t just the potion association; even he began to wonder if Arix continuing to study mecha was wasting her talent in potion making.
If she continued in the Department of Chemistry, she might become the next legendary potion master!
But Magen couldn’t bear the thought of forcing a girl who loved mecha so much to study only potions. It felt wrong.
"I will take Arix as my apprentice, but if she really has no talent for mecha, I will guide her to focus more on potions," Magen said, rubbing his brow and sighing heavily.
Hearing this, Matis breathed a sigh of relief and smiled. "Thank you. When the school term starts, I’ll have her add you on her opticomputer."
"Okay. If there’s nothing else, I’ll hang up now." Magen ended the call and looked towards the training base next door.
He felt uncertain. He didn’t know if he was making the right decision, but he wouldn’t regret it. He wanted to protect the light in that child’s eyes because he knew the pain of wanting to study mecha but being unable to.
When Magen was very young, his parents both died for the Alliance. Without their protection, his relatives took over his family’s property and kicked him out of his home. He ended up on the street as a beggar.
During his time on the streets, he envied mecha makers. On one hand, he loved mecha, on the other hand, those people were so well respected and lived a well-off life.
Magen swore that he’d try his best to be a mecha maker.
But without money to attend a proper school, Magen had to sneak into classes and watch from the corners. Too many time were he caught by security, beaten up, and thrown out like garbage.
Despite this, Magen never gave up. After many attempts, he succeed—someone either gave orders or the security guards just turned a blind eye to him.
Later, he found out that the person who helped him was Matis, who also helped him reclaim his inheritance, allowing him to study legitimately.
The two became brothers, until both fell in love with Arix’s grandmother, which strained their relationship.
Despite this, both Matis and Frances were crucial in Magen’s life, so he chose to step aside early, letting Matis and Frances be together.
After recalling the pains of his youth, Magen skillfully took a photo out of the drawer. He looked nostalgically at the young girl with a radiant smile in the photo.
As he looked, a bittersweet smile appeared on Magen’s lips. "Frances, if you had stayed a little longer, you could see your granddaughter now. She’s a remarkable and outstanding child. If you saw her, you would definitely like her."
The photo couldn’t speak, but the girl’s smile remained as if in agreement.

chapters.title: Chapter 83: Preparations
chapters.content:
Chapter 83: Preparations
The sun had just risen over the training base, but the comprehensive training ground was already bustling with activity.
The place was filled with a large number of military students, and even teachers from various military academies had appeared at the base.
Leading them was the examiner from the five military academies. The students had already seen them at the entrance exam.
Arix saw Marlone, one of the five examiners, on the podium. They noticed each other and exchanged smiles and waves due to the formal setting.
At 8 AM, with everyone gathered, the instructors confirmed the student numbers from each academy and began the pre-competition preparations.
The rules for the competition stated that no external items were allowed. The students had to hand over everything except their clothes, digital wristbands, and a knife given by the instructors. Even their Space Buttons were taken away, causing many students to groan in protest.
They would be spending a whole week outdoors with no gear, which seemed very harsh. They wondered what good a small knife could do. Could it feed them? Keep them warm at night? Provide any real sense of security?
In the age of space travel, military students were used to advanced weapons, and a small knife seemed as useful as a nail clipper to them. Useful, but not much.
However, faced with the threat of losing points, the students had no choice but to comply and stay quiet.
After the preparations, Nyx, the head of the training base, finally spoke from the podium. "Hello, students! Your month of freshman training is coming to an end. To conclude, we have decided to hold a competition to see how much you’ve improved. So, do you have confidence in yourselves? Answer me loudly."
The students grumbled internally but still shouted, "Yes, sir!"
Nyx nodded with a smile, "Good. Now, I will announce the rules. This competition requires teamwork. Each team earns one point for every beast they kill. The top ten teams will receive an extra 100 points. Each team consists of five people, based on your wristband numbers. Teams 1-5, 6-10, and so on. Survive in the Sugli Forest for a week, and you pass. Here’s a note for you: if you feel your life is in danger, remove your wristband, and an instructor will locate and retrieve you. Now, get ready to board the warships."
With that, six massive warships from the Fifth Legion base landed in front of the comprehensive training ground.
The instructors led their students from each academy onto separate warships. Once all the students were aboard, the examiners and the training base leaders boarded their own warship.
Then, the six warships flew south together.
Inside the Hecaris Military Academy warship, students were calling out numbers to find their teammates based on their wristbands. After half an hour, Arix finally met up with her team. Her four teammates were three boys and one girl. To Arix’s surprise, two of them were people she knew.
"Arix! I can’t believe we’re teammates!" Calista said excitedly, linking her arm with Arix.
"And my brother is also a teammate," Arix said, glancing at Drexel. She looked at Calista and laughed.
Arix had already expected Drexel to be her teammate since he was standing next to her when they received their number plates. Drexel’s number was 70, which was close to hers. The only surprise was that Calista’s number was 66. What a coincidence!
Calista shyly held Arix’s arm, stealing glances at Drexel.
’Such a cute little fangirl!’
Arix thought, hugging her own arm and refusing to admit she was a bit jealous of how her friend was so obsessed with Drexel.
"Arix, come over here with your friend. Let’s discuss the competition," Drexel said. He didn’t notice the little secret between Arix and Calista.
Drexel and the other two teammates were already discussing the Sugli Forest.
Arix and Calista joined them, and the teammates sized each other up.
"We’ll be together for a week, so let’s start with introductions. I’ll go first. I’m Drexel from the Department of Combat. I’m studying command as a second major. My psychic and physical powers are both Supergiant-Class. If we’ll agree, I proposed to be the team leader for this competition," Drexel said, his expression serious and reliable.
At home, Drexel could laugh and play without restraint, but in front of others, he was the rightful heir of the Kering family and possibly a future admiral.
Even Arix had to admit that Drexel was very charismatic like this. It was no wonder he had so many admirers at the Hecaris Military Academy.
Arix glanced at Calista, who was looking at Drexel with admiration, and sighed.
The other teammates exchanged looks and nodded in agreement with Drexel taking the lead.
"Next, it’s my turn. I’m Arix from the Mecha Department and the Department of Chemistry. My psychic power is Supergiant-Class, and my physical power is Star-Class. Nice to meet you all," Arix said with a smile.
"My name is Calista, from the Department of Chemistry. Both my psychic power and physical power are Star-Class. Nice to see you," Calista introduced herself shyly.
"My name is Femi, from the Psychic Ware Department. My psychic power is Star-Class, and my physical power is Planet-Class. Good to see you guys," Femi said. He had a baby face, and even his personality and eyes were a bit childish.
"My name is Dae-jung, from the Department of Combat. My physical power is Subgiant-Class, and my psychic power is Star-Class. Nice to meet you," Dae-jung introduced himself. He was a handsome young man, but his personality was a bit cold and distant, giving off a feeling of a cold moonlit night.
"Good, now we all know each other," Drexel said. "We need to survive in the Sugli Forest for a week. The key is teamwork. When we encounter beasts, we must stay calm and work together. My plan is to first establish a safe camp. During the day, we’ll search for food and water, and at night, we’ll take turns keeping watch. Does anyone have any questions or suggestions?"
The others shook their heads, agreeing with the plan.

chapters.title: Chapter 84: Arriving At Sugli Forest
chapters.content:
Chapter 84: Arriving At Sugli Forest
After everyone introduced themselves, Drexel began to speak. "Let’s talk about The Sugli Forest. Everyone, share what you know about it. Then, we will summarize and decide our next steps. Arix, you go first."
Arix nodded. Then, looking at everyone, he said, "I don’t know much about The Sugli Forest. I only know it covers more than 500 hectares. There are many strange beasts living there, and in the center, there are Celesterrors, which are basically like monsters. So, unless it’s necessary, I suggest not going to the center."
Celesterrors were different from normal beasts. They had powerful psychic abilities, and were born with Star-Class physical power, which gets stronger as they age. They are so formidable that even insectoids avoid them.
Most importantly, in the Alliance, Celesterror were protected animals, like rhinos in the past world. People couldn’t kill, sell, or hurt them, unless one wanted to end up in jail or worse.
Hearing Arix’s words, everyone nodded in agreement. Then they all looked at the next person.
Calista felt nervous with everyone looking at her, especially since Drexel was watching too. She couldn’t speak at all. Seeing this, Arix gently held her hand to encourage her, as if silently saying,
’Don’t be afraid, I’m here with you!’
Calista felt warm inside and finally gathered some courage. "I once went to the edge of The Sugli Forest with my dad. The thing I remember most is that there are many poisonous insects and leeches, so we should prepare before going into the forest."
"That’s very useful information. Calista, you and Arix will handle the insect repellent, okay?" Drexel asked, looking at both of them.
Arix nodded calmly, and Calista nodded excitedly, even making little fists with her hands.
Then it was Femi’s turn. He seemed oddly excited. "I’ve heard that The Sugli Forest has little pigs. They are a top ingredient in the Alliance’s high-end restaurants. And there are also matsutake mushrooms, hazelnuts, and"
"Stop! That’s enough. You will handle the food," Drexel said quickly, cutting him off.
"No problem! Leave it to me." Femi nodded enthusiastically and agreed readily.
Drexel breathed a sigh of relief, then looked at Dae-jung. "What about you, Dae-jung?"
"The most dangerous thing out there isn’t the forest, but the people," Dae-jung said seriously. "The Sugli Forest’s Celesterrors are always targets for poachers, and there are many mercenaries too. Poachers are easy to guard against, but mercenaries are unpredictable. I suggest we keep our distance from them during the competition."
Drexel thought for a moment before replying, "Dae-jung has a point. But usually, the area is closed off before the student competitions to protect students and prevent cheating. So, we’ll consider your suggestion. Does anyone else have any ideas? If not, I’ll share some thoughts for everyone to consider."
The four nodded and focused on Drexel, waiting for him to speak.
"I’ve only been to The Sugli Forest once. What everyone said is mostly right, but there’s another thing I need to emphasize. With autumn approaching, the beasts are starting to gather food. The herbivores aren’t much of a problem, but the carnivores might see us as food. So, our main concern should be those beasts. We also need to take turns keeping watch at night. This task will be handled by us three guys. Now..." Drexel continued to discuss possible situations they might encounter during the competition.
Amidst their discussion, the flight of their spaceship reached its destination. Six large warships landed at the outer edge of the Sugli Forest. Hundreds of people, stopped by a security cordon a hundred meters away, were talking about the closure of the forest.
"A military academy, no less. They shut down the entire Sugli Forest for a kids’ competition!" a disgruntled mercenary complained.
"Those ’kids’ could beat you so out of shape that your wife wouldn’t recognize you," an older mercenary retorted with a roll of his eyes.
"Exactly, and those ’kids’ will protect you, your wife, and your children on the front lines someday. Don’t you feel ashamed saying such things?" another mercenary added.
The complaining mercenary fell silent and walked away.
"Hmph!" The other mercenaries continued to watch the six warships, eager to see the spectacle.
When the students disembarked, the mercenaries exclaimed in surprise, as if a group of baboons had descended from the mountains.
Arix and his friends were drawn by the noise and turned to see the people standing a hundred meters away behind the security cordon.
They wore a mix of lightweight, worn-out combat gear, and their weapons ranged from guns to clubs and large machetes. Just by looking at them, it was clear they were mercenaries who lived by hunting.
The military students curiously watched the mercenaries, just as the mercenaries, who rarely saw military students, watched them. Both groups observed each other with interest.
Some particularly outgoing mercenaries started cheering for the military students.
"Kids! Go for it! You’re the best!"
"The next Alliance admiral is among you! Go, go, go!"
"You can do it, kids! Ura! Ura!"
The students, feeling the mercenaries’ enthusiasm, responded warmly.
"Thank you! But we’re not kids!"
"Haha!" The mercenaries laughed at the students’ response and teased them even more enthusiastically.
The instructors stood by, watching the bickering between the mercenaries and the military students. Instead of stopping them, they raised their eyebrows and smiled, enjoying the show.
When it was almost 9 o’clock, an instructor coughed to get the students’ attention. Then, the instructor said seriously, "The competition is about to start. Kids, get yourselves ready."
"Yes, sir!" the students replied loudly. Some students waved goodbye to the mercenaries.
At 9 o’clock, the instructor announced the start of the competition. All the military students rushed into The Sugli Forest like a swarm of migrating mule deer.
After the students left, the sixth spaceship unloaded at least a thousand soldiers. They wore silver-white combat suits that could make them invisible. After disembarking, they disappeared upon receiving a command.
The soldiers used tracking bracelets to locate the students they were assigned to follow. They hid around the students, watching carefully to see if they were in any danger. They’ll interven if necessary.
Soldiers following students from a humble background had it easier, since these students had some knowledge of survival skills.
Those following the rich kids, on the contrary, had a hard time. Quite a few rich kids didn’t take any precautions and got bitten by poisonous insects, causing them to go into shock or faint from fear.
One student got bitten by a leech and just stared at it in terror.
’Why don’t you pull it off?’
the soldier thought as he observed in a distance.
The student fainted, convinced he wouldn’t survive the leech bite, and he even carved a farewell message on a tree before passing out.
’Is he really that fragile... but he just...’
the soldier wondered.

chapters.title: Chapter 85: Surviving The Wild
chapters.content:
Chapter 85: Surviving The Wild
The soldier checked the fainted student’s condition. After confirming he was unconscious, the soldier came out of hiding. They removed the bracelet from the student who was in shock from the insect bite and quickly sent them to a waiting Lev.
For the student who fainted from the leech, the soldier felt a headache. This student wasn’t in immediate danger but was unconscious and could be at risk.
The soldier shook his head as he looked at the message carved on the tree. Then, he decided to stay with the student until he woke up. But he wasn’t going to do anything to wake the student up, so whether he could make it would depend on their luck.
The Sugli Forest was vast, and Arix and the others didn’t know what was happening to the other students.
Their first task was to find a tree suitable for making ropes. They peeled its bark and started making ropes of various thicknesses.
Once everyone had some rope, they used thin ropes to tie around their sleeves and pant legs. This way, they could effectively prevent insects from crawling into their clothes.
With basic protection done, Arix and the others began to collect ingredients that could repel insects, snakes, and ants. They also gathered medicinal ingredients when they found them.
Drexel led the group, focusing on finding a water source. In the wild, drinking water, washing, cooking, and cooling all depend on water, making it a crucial part of survival.
They moved forward, observing plant growth and the direction of dense roots. Occasionally, Drexel would put his ear to the ground, listening for the sound of water.
After a while, Drexel finally heard the faint sound of flowing water. It wasn’t loud, but it meant that a water source was nearby. Feeling pleased, Drexel stood up and blew a loud whistle with his fingers.
The four teammates who were gathering nearby immediately looked up, alert, and quickly returned to Drexel.
Soon, the five of them were together. Arix and Calista each carried some bundled medicinal ingredients. Femi had tied up a few rabbits and wild chickens with rope, while Dae-jung had used large leaves to hold a lot of fruit.
" Drexel, did you find something?" Femi asked curiously.
Drexel nodded, "I heard the gurgling of water. Let’s stick together for now and not split up."
Arix and the others agreed. Not long after, they found a creek.
With water secured, they could now start a fire and cook. Each person took on a different task: some carved wooden bowls with knives, some used sticks to make fire, and others cleaned the game by the river.
Arix was making a water filter. She carved several pieces of wood with her knife, drilled a hole in the bottom, and lined the bottom with deodorized hemp rope.
She then added layers of charcoal, stones, fine sand, stones, and water plants. She tied the simple filter high up with hemp rope and poured river water into the wood container, letting the clean water collect in the container below.
Everyone worked with enthusiasm because these tasks were new to them and seemed quite interesting. When it was finally time to eat, each person had a skewer of grilled meat and a portion of boiled filtered water.
The meal was simple, but Femi’s cooking skills were good. After tasting the food, almost everyone gave him a thumbs-up.
To keep up their strength, Drexel and his team even caught a deer and collected five bowls of blood. Each person pinched their nose to avoid the smell and drank a bowl.
In the wild, salt is essential for maintaining strength, and when there’s no salt, drinking animal blood can help replenish it.
After drinking the blood and rinsing their mouths, Arix and the team began eating and discussing their next moves.
The competition was not only about surviving in the wilderness but also about hunting fierce beasts to earn points.
"After we finish eating and resting for a bit, let’s move deeper into the forest," Dae-jung suggested. "The outer area is safer, but there are fewer beasts, so it’s hard to earn points."
"Femi and Dae-jung are the strongest fighters among us. If we’re hunting beasts, they can lead the attack. Calista and I can provide support, and Arix can finish off the beasts. How does that sound?" Drexel suggested, his eyes gleaming with excitement.
The others nodded in agreement, thinking it was a good plan.
"If we encounter something too tough to handle, we should retreat for now. Don’t push too hard. The forest is still unknown territory. Today, we should focus on exploring and understanding the environment before deciding our next steps," Drexel added after some thought.
The team agreed, ready to face the challenges ahead in their quest for survival and victory.
Half an hour passed, and Arix’s group finished their discussion. They rested for a bit before heading into the inner part of the forest.
Before reaching the inner part, Arix and the others could relax a bit. But as soon as they entered the area where strange beasts appeared, they formed an arrow-shape formation and moved forward cautiously.
Drexel held a dagger and led the way. Arix and Calista, also holding daggers, walked alertly on either side behind Drexel.
Behind Arix’s group were Femi and Dae-jung. Dae-jung not only watched over Femi but also kept an eye on the rear to prevent any beasts from attacking from behind.
"Roar!"
The deafening beast roar made Drexel motion for a pause. Drexel then looked at Arix and nodded.
Arix understood and quickly climbed a tree to look for the source of the sound from a higher vantage point.
While doing this, Arix felt a strange sense of familiarity, as if she had done this before. She shook her head to clear her thoughts and focused on the direction of the roar.
There were five beasts, as large as prehistoric creatures, attacking some students from the Hecaris Military Academy. Two of the students were already seriously injured.
Arix swallowed nervously. These beasts in this interstellar era were different from what she had imagined. She thought they would be like the wild animals from her past life.
If she wasn’t mistaken, these looked like brown bears, but now they were bigger than elephants.
Maybe as humans evolved, so did the beasts.
Seeing the five students in danger, Arix couldn’t think too much and called down to the others, "There’s a group of our classmates from the Hecaris Military Academy ahead, surrounded by five strange brown bears. Should we help?"
"Go help them!" Drexel said firmly, out of concern for their classmates.
"Yes, get them now!" Dae-jung agreed, though he was more excited about earning points. Helping others was just a bonus.
"Alright!" Arix jumped down from the tree and quickly led the way towards the northwest.
"Arix, is it the northwest? This is too slow. Dae-jung and I will go ahead first," Drexel said, frowning.
"Yes, it’s the northwest, about 500 meters away. You two go ahead; we’ll catch up soon," Arix said seriously.
"Okay!" Drexel nodded decisively. He told Arix to be careful, then he and Dae-jung quickly disappeared from sight.
Arix, left behind, watched the two move like lightning with envy. She gritted her teeth and ran faster in Drexel’s direction.
Luckily, the incident site wasn’t far. When Arix and the others arrived, Drexel and Dae-jung had already killed one of the bears.
At that moment, they were fighting four bears, desperately trying to prevent them from further injuring the five students.
The students were either seriously or lightly wounded.
Arix watched worriedly for a while, ensuring that Drexel and Dae-jung were not in immediate danger, and then she breathed a little easier.
She quickly turned to Calista and Femi, "Let’s go check on them."
"Okay," Calista and Femi nodded vigorously. They followed Arix and quickly reached the five injured students, and then they began to check their conditions.
Arix went to the most severely injured student. He was already unconscious, and Arix started examining him.
The student had a dislocated left arm, a severe wound that was bleeding heavily, and several minor injuries that were not too serious.
After understanding the basic situation, Arix started treatment right away. She pressed the pressure point on the student’s arm to stop the bleeding.
Then she carefully tore open the student’s shirt. After taking three hemostatic herbs from her waist, she chewed them, and applied them to the wound.
The dislocation was easier to handle. Arix pressed a few times and then set the arm back in place with one strong motion.
The other students and Calista were astonished at Arix’s treatment speed.
It seemed like her medical skills were as good as a treatment capsule’s.
’Is she some kind of medical genius?’
they wondered.
Busy with her tasks, Arix didn’t notice her friends’ reactions. She quickly moved to another severely injured and unconscious student.
She told Calista, who was treating him, "Calista, let me handle this one. Please watch over the student beside you. Tell me if anything goes wrong."
"Okay!" Calista nodded firmly.
Calista checked the student Arix had just treated and was amazed that such severe injuries had been handled so easily.
’How did she managed to heal him without a treatment capsule or medicines? Is it magic?’
Calista looked at Arix with a mix of shock and admiration. She had thought Drexel was impressive, but Arix was even more so. She felt like she might switch her admiration from Drexel to Arix now.
Treating injuries was as natural to Arix as breathing. In less than ten minutes, she had also saved the other severely injured student.
Meanwhile, Calista had already helped the three less seriously injured students.
After ensuring all the injured students were taken care of, Arix breathed a sigh of relief and then turned her attention to the battlefield.
While Arix watched Drexel and Dae-jung fight, on the Sixth Warship’s meeting room...
Five examiners and five chief training instructors, along with the head of the training base, Nyx, were discussing Arix.
"A master-level doctor wouldn’t be better than this!" Mendez commented, adjusting his glasses while watching Arix on the live feed.
"Arix has always been excellent," Ortiz added, praising her. After all, having such an outstanding student made him proud as her instructor.
"Well well... This little one always brings us so many surprises. I suddenly want to knock her down and take her home secretly," Laiden joked with a chuckle.
"Hmph!" Marlone snorted proudly, feeling too good to even bother arguing with him.
The only person feeling uneasy was Solis from the Koros Military Academy. Arix had once been their student, and now they had lost her to the Hecaris Military Academy.
Thinking about this, Solis’s mood soured even more. Only someone who had lost a billion-dollar lottery could understand his current feeling.
The more Solis thought about it, the more he slumped in his chair, feeling completely dejected.

chapters.title: Chapter 86: Two "Monsters"
chapters.content:
Chapter 86: Two "Monsters"
In the Sugli Forest...
An angry brown bear roared at Drexel and Dae-jung. His sharp claws and scary teeth kept attacking the two people.
Sometimes, the bear even lifted his huge paw, like a small mountain, and stomped where they stood. The power of his stomp left deep holes in the ground.
Despite this scary attack, Drexel and Dae-jung did not panic. Instead, they worked well together.
Drexel faced the bear and attacked him directly, while Dae-jung, like a sneaky assassin, kept bothering the bear. Sometimes, when he saw a chance, he would stab his knife into the bear’s eyes or the soft skin on his neck.
The rest of the bear’s body was as tough as iron, and they couldn’t hurt him at all.
Outside the battle, Arix noticed what was happening and felt very frustrated.
Arix had thought that the beasts from the interstellar era would be like the ones she had seen in her last life. So, she thought a knife would be enough.
But when she saw these beasts, she realized how hard the training base was on them.
It was like giving the students forks and knives to fight lions and elephants.
It was clear that the training base didn’t care about their lives, or at least Arix thought so.
Arix rubbed her forehead, sighed, and then said to Calista and Femi, "I’ll go help. You two stay here and take care of the injured ones."
Calista and Femi, a chemist and a Psychic Ware user, couldn’t help much in this fight. If they went there, they would just be food for the beast.
Calista knew this too, so she helplessly said to Arix, "Arix, be careful."
Arix nodded. Then she took out her knife and rushed to the battlefield.
She couldn’t fight the bear head-on, so she, like Dae-jung, kept bothering him.
"Arix, why are you here too?" Drexel didn’t want Arix to help.
Arix gave Drexel an annoyed look and said, "What? You think I’ll slow you down? Want to bet who can kill more?"
"Sure, if I win, you have to call me ’respected brother’ every day during the competition," Drexel said as he jumped left and turned to avoid the bear’s claws. He teased Arix while doing so.
Arix raised an eyebrow and, even more annoyed, said, "Fine, if I win, you have to call me ’big sis’ during this whole competition!"
"No problem, deal!" Drexel confidently smiled. Then his strong psychic power flowed out from his body.
That scary psychic power gradually turned into an ice-blue spear in Drexel’s hand.
Psychic power materialization is a very magical skill. It can turn imagined things into reality, sometimes even stronger than the real thing.
But to achieve this, one must have complete control over their psychic power, and it must be at least Star-Class level.
They also need to practice for many years to use materialized weapons smoothly. Otherwise, the materialized objects would shatter like fireworks on contact, having no attack effect at all.
With the materialized icy spear, Drexel stopped avoiding the bear and charged at him.
When he got close, he leaped up, grabbed the spear with both hands, and thrust it down hard.
The fierce bear didn’t even know what happened before the spear pierced his head, freezing him in place.
Drexel grinned, withdrew the spear, and jumped off the bear’s head.
When he landed, the bear fell too, kicking up a cloud of dust.
Drexel’s first kill in this competition was complete, and other people almost wanted to applaud for his amazing show.
Arix couldn’t materialize psychic power yet, but her psychic power was already the strongest weapon. This was something even Drexel couldn’t match.
A powerful wave of psychic power surged from Arix’s body. Then she, like a drill, pierced another bear’s head. The bear let out a miserable cry, then mysteriously fell to the ground, bleeding from his eyes, nose, ears, and mouth, dead.
Psychic power piercing was a direct attack using psychic power. If someone was hit by it, at best, they became an idiot; at worst, like the bear in front of them, they’d suffer brain death.
The only drawback of psychic power piercing was that it consumed a lot of psychic power, unlike materialized weapons, which saved more energy.
Drexel looked at the bear who died miserably and swallowed hard. He thought, "How did my sister’s psychic power become so scary?"
The remaining two bears, seeing their companion’s tragic death, were scared and tried to run back into the forest.
But Arix and Drexel wouldn’t let them escape. They both chased after them.
Arix’s psychic power, like a drill, pierced one bear’s head.
Drexel used all his strength to throw the materialized spear like a javelin. The spear shoot across the trees like a falling star, and at last, it pierced the other bear right on his head..
Finally, they heard two miserable cries, and the two poor bears fell to the ground, lifeless.
"It’s a tie. Looks like we won’t hear Arix call me ’respected brother,’ too bad," Drexel said regretfully.
Arix rolled her eyes and snorted.
And Dae-jung, who had watched the entire process from the side, looked at the siblings like they were monsters.
’These two really deserve to be siblings, each more terrifying than the other’!
Dae-jung had some mental preparation for Drexel’s ferocity. After all, Drexel was the heir of the Kering family, so he was definitely not weak.
But Arix truly surprised him. He had thought Arix was a gentle and obedient girl. However, she only looked gentle and obedient. When she got fierce, she was as terrifying as a wild beast.
Dae-jung looked at the siblings with complicated feelings. Then he turned and walked towards Femi and the others.
After spending time with such monsters, he now preferred to stay with normal people.
However, this unexpected shock gave Dae-jung a mental shadow. He decided that he would never trust people who looked gentle and obedient again, as they might suddenly turn into someone like Arix.
After cleaning up the whole place and collecting the furs, Arix and the others helped their injured classmates find a safe cave.
Then they left them there and headed to the place they were going to.
With their classmates watching sadly, Arix and the others waved. Then, they turned and headed deeper into the forest.
In the afternoon, Arix and the group hunted and killed a few more wild beasts.
When the sky turned red with the sunset, Arix reminded them, "It’s getting late. Let’s continue tomorrow."
Drexel looked at the sky and agreed, "Okay, let’s find a place by the river to rest."
Soon, they found a suitable cave. They set up camp there.
After securing a place to stay, it was time to think about dinner. As for the chef tonight...
Everyone looked at Femi. He was the only one in the group who could cook decent food.
Drexel and Dae-jung were rough guys who would rather eat raw food than cook, because their dishes tasted worse than raw food.
Arix’s food tasted good, but it seemed cursed. Out of three meals, two would definitely cause stomach problems.
The memory of sending Cassian to the hospital was still fresh, so she dared not cook anymore. Even if she did, she wouldn’t let her teammates eat it, for fear they might be eliminated not by beasts, but by her cooking. That would make her famous again in the five military academies.
Calista liked to cook, but her food was so bad that even a captured rabbit refused to eat it and starved to death. The rabbit proved with its life how terrible Calista’s cooking was.
The more they thought about it, the more grateful they were to have Femi. Without him, the next seven days would be unbearable.
After helping prepare the ingredients and setting out the plates, fruits, and water, they all sat neatly on the ground, waiting for Femi to serve them.
Soon, Femi came into the cave with five leaf-wrapped packages. He gave the two smaller ones to Arix and Calista. The remaining three, he shared among the boys.
Arix thanked him and eagerly opened her leaf package. Inside were evenly cut pieces of roasted meat, smelling delicious.
The boys didn’t have it as good. Their leaf packages also had roasted meat, but not cut, so they had to use their knives to cut it themselves.
Arix looked at the delicious roasted meat and swallowed. Then, Arix picked up a piece with chopsticks and happily chewed it.
"Wow! This is delicious! Femi, you’re amazing." Arix was impressed after the first bite and gave Femi a thumbs up.
"Yes, it’s so good!" Calista also gave a thumbs up.
"It’s really good!" Drexel, too, gave a thumbs up.
Dae-jung didn’t say anything, but he nodded to show his approval.
"It even tastes salty. Femi, where did you find salt?" Calista asked, puzzled. In a forest, there shouldn’t be any salt.
Femi blushed from the compliments and smiled shyly. Then he answered, "In the afternoon, I found a saltbush. Its fruits have a salty coating that can replace salt for now."
"Oh, it’s a saltbush!" Calista realized.
"Yes, that’s it," Femi smiled.
"Femi is amazing," the four of them looked admiringly at the person who would be their provider for the next seven days.
After dinner, everyone planned to rest early. Arix and Calista slept together in a cave. The three boys took turns keeping watch by the fire.

chapters.title: Chapter 87: Psychic Weapons
chapters.content:
Chapter 87: Psychic Weapons
The next day, before dawn, Arix woke up, stretched, and walked out of the cave.
"Arix, it’s still early. Do you want to sleep a bit more?" Drexel was on the last watch and showed concern for his sister waking up so early.
Arix shook her head and sat next to Drexel, "You go sleep. I’ll keep watch."
Drexel was touched and looked at his sister with pride, "Surprise, surprise. The heartless Arix has grown up and started to care about me."
Arix felt annoyed and a vein popped on her forehead. She glared at Drexel and said, "Now choose: go to hell, or go to sleep?"
"Sleep!" Drexel jumped up and quickly moved away from Arix. As he entered the cave, he added, "Arix, with a temper like that, you’ll never get a boyfriend."
Arix didn’t want to respond and threw a small stick at him.
Drexel caught the stick, smiling. He didn’t want to throw it away and took it into the cave with him.
When it got quiet, Arix poked the fire with a stick, watching the flames grow.
Yesterday’s bear attack still affected her. Even though she had been in this era for almost two months, her mind was still in the past, thinking like she was still on Earth.
For example, many species here were different from those on Earth, but Arix instinctively compared them to Earth creatures in her imagination. In the end, it was because she hadn’t fully accepted that she could never return to Earth.
After all, she still had her parents who raised her, the elders who always criticized but also protected her, and her childhood friend who joked about wanting her to take care of him but ended up taking care of her. These bonds were the deepest for Arix and were impossible to forget.
The more she thought about it, the more it hurt. Arix sighed heavily and looked dejectedly at the fire burning in the pit. The warm firelight only highlighted the loneliness and sadness on her face.
"Arix, a penny for you thought?"
Cupid was very sensitive to emotions. He suddenly felt Arix was unhappy in the psychic world, so he quickly left the psychic world. Then he jumped into Arix’s arms and asked in a cute voice.
Seeing Cupid acting cute, Arix finally smiled and gently petted Cupid’s head. Then, Arix spoke with some emotion, "I was thinking about what happened yesterday. I didn’t expect the beasts of this world to be so big. When I saw them yesterday, I was really surprised."
"Arix, don’t be afraid. I will protect you," Cupid said, thinking Arix was still scared. He rubbed its small head against Arix’s hand to comfort her.
"We will protect you too," said Sophia and Vita, who had also come out of the psychic world. The two little ones sat on the ground, one with a warm expression and the other with a cold one, looking at Arix.
Especially since Sophia, who was usually so indifferent, said this, Arix felt even more touched.
"Thank you, Cupid, Sophia, Vita. I understand now. With you here, I won’t be afraid anymore." Seeing these adorable little ones, Arix’s heart felt warm.
Feeling touched, Arix hugged the three little ones and rubbed her face against their fluffy cheeks.
Yes, she understood now. Since the past can’t be changed, she should cherish the present.
Matis, Thaddeus, Fleur, Sister Gwen, Kellan, Cirilla... and Cupid and the others were her future. What more could she ask for?
If she let the past affect the future, Arix felt she would be letting someone down.
’Hmm? Who is that SOMEONE?’
Arix suddenly felt like she had forgotten that "someone," the one who seemed very important to her.
But no matter how hard she tried to remember, she could only think of an old man with a kind smile and lots of white beard.
Although she couldn’t see his face clearly, she could tell he cared a lot about her.
’Is it sims? He’s the only elder with a white beard I know.’
But, that couldn’t be right. She had only met Sims recently, yet this old man felt like someone she had known for a very long time, even longer than her parents from her past life.
’How can I forget someone so important?’
Since she couldn’t figure it out, Arix decided not to think about it. Maybe it was just her imagination.
The morning sun finally rose. As soon as she let Cupid and the others go back to her psychic world, her teammates came out of the cave, yawning.
After washing up, everyone sat together with a bowl of soup, discussing their plans for the day.
"As long as we get points, I don’t care where we go," Dae-jung said, not minding.
"Anything is fine with me," Arix replied, being very easy-going about such things.
"We’ll follow the leaders," Calista and Femi agreed, having no opinions of their own.
Drexel thought this team was too easy to lead, which made him feel a bit strangely disappointed. He finally spoke in a laid-back manner, "Then let’s keep moving towards the inner area."
"Okay!" Arix and the others agreed.
After finishing breakfast, they saw it was still early, so they decided to wait a bit before setting out.
Taking advantage of the free time, Arix asked Drexel about his psychic weapon from yesterday.
"I want to learn about how to materialize psychic weapons. Can you teach me how to do that?" Arix had been interested in psychic weapons since yesterday and now remembered to ask.
"Call me ’respected brother,’ and I’ll teach you, and I’ll make sure you learn it well. How about that?" Drexel put his arm around Arix’s shoulder and smiled mischievously.
