Arix gave a cold laugh, took out a dagger, and with a sinister smile, asked, "Will you teach me willingly now, or...?"
"I was just joking to lighten the mood. Daggers are dangerous; you shouldn’t play with them. Be good and put it away, otherwise, it will get in the way when I teach you," Drexel’s mischievous smile froze, and he quickly tried to appease her.
"Hmph!" Arix snorted coldly and put away the dagger.
Then she gave Drexel a burning glare, her eyes seeming to say,
’Why aren’t you starting already? What are you waiting for?’
Dae-jung and the others were also bored, so they decided to try learning too.
"Ahem, psychic weapons, as the name suggests, are weapons constructed from your psychic power. First, imagine what kind of weapon you want to have," Drexel explained gently and patiently.
’A weapon I want?’
Arix thought for a moment and imagined the weapon she felt most comfortable using.
Seeing his sister’s relaxed expression, Drexel guessed she had an idea and smiled, "Now, open your palms and imagine it appearing there."
Arix nodded, focusing her psychic power on her palm. A sharp, cold weapon appeared in her hand.
When Drexel saw Arix’s weapon, he laughed but quickly stopped himself. He tried to suppress his laughter, his face turning red.
The others also materialized their weapons: Calista had a bow and arrow, Femi had a chef’s knife slightly longer than a dagger, and Dae-jung had a heavy sword. But instead of focusing on their weapons, they all stared at Arix’s psychic weapon in surprise.
Arix’s hand held a delicate, small scalpel, making even a dagger look large and robust next to it.
"Pfft! Hahaha!!" Drexel couldn’t hold back his laughter. He pointed at Arix, trying to say something, but he was laughing too hard to speak.
"Arix, it’s okay. Next time, we’ll make better weapons," Calista said, trying to comfort her friend.
"Yeah, yeah. It’s normal for the first time not to be perfect," Femi added, also trying to reassure her.
Dae-jung didn’t say anything, but he nodded along with Calista and Femi to show his support.
Arix remained calm. She held the scalpel and made a few slicing motions, her voice showing a hint of pleasure, "Thanks, actually, it’s pretty good."
It could save lives and also take someone by surprise. For her, it was the perfect, versatile tool.

chapters.title: Chapter 88: A Dangerous Territory
chapters.content:
Chapter 88: A Dangerous Territory
For Arix, the scalpel was not only easy to use; also, it seemed it didn’t need to be sterilized for surgeries like the normal ones. It was a really great tool.
Arix thought she could try to create other surgical tools with her psychic powers someday.
Arix skillfully twirled the scalpel between her fingers, feeling more and more satisfied.
Calista and the others saw Arix was happy with her creation and felt relieved. Then, they turned their attention to their own psychic weapons and began to play with them curiously.
Calista studied her manifested bow for a while. She then created a long arrow and tried to shoot it. However, the arrow disappeared into thin air before it flew even half a meter.
Calista wasn’t upset; instead, she repeated the process with excitement.
After shooting about a dozen arrows, however, her head started to hurt, as if a rubber band was tied around it. This was a sign of her psychic power running out, so she stopped quickly to rest.
Femi wanted to try chopping meat with his psychic weapon. But even though it looked sharp, it disappeared before touching the meat.
After several tries, Femi began to doubt himself. Looking at the untouched meat, he could only keep trying with a frustrated expression.
Dae-jung was the strongest among the three. His heavy sword was not only large but also powerful, already able to leave deep cuts in the trees.
They all practiced for a long time until Drexel noticed it was getting late and called out, "Time to move on!"
The four of them nodded and then cleaned up their temporary camp.
Later, they headed deeper into the forest in the formation they used yesterday. It seemed the beasts were still sleeping at this time, so they didn’t encounter any danger along the way.
They smoothly reached the border between the central and inner parts of the forest. There was a stone tablet blocking the path, with eight big letters on it: "Celesterror Territory, No Entry."
Seeing the sign only made Arix more curious about what was inside. The five of them exchanged glances, all understanding each other without a word.
"How about we go in and take a look?" Arix suggested, her eyes sparkling. She had never seen a Celesterror before but heard they were very beautiful, which attracted many poachers.
In the Alliance, Celesterrors were protected animals, but in the Empire, they were incredibly rare and highly sought after at auctions. It was said that their prices could go over one billion astracredits for each.
"I think we should head in there. Our instructor never said we can’t enter Celesterror territory, so that’s basically allowed," Femi said with a sly grin.
"We’ll just take a quick look and come back. It should be fine," Calista added. She had only seen Celesterrors on the interstellarnet, so she was excited about the chance to see a real one.
As for Drexel and Dae-jung, they looked at each other, then shrugged. Seeing other people’s determination, he knew he had no choice now.
Once they made up their minds, the five of them crossed the stone tablet and entered the central area of The Sugli Forest, where the Celesterrors lived.
At the same time, in the meeting Room of the Sixth Warship...
Ortiz held his forehead in frustration. He had been so proud moments ago, and now he felt utterly embarrassed. Disobedient students were common, but...
’Do they really have to drag their instructor into their antics?’
"This is just great," Ortiz muttered.
Laiden chuckled and looked at Marlone. "Your niece is quite the troublemaker."
"Hmph! Not as much as yours!" Marlone replied sarcastically, watching the footage from the nanobots. Poor Elio was being chased by a group of wild beasts, his fat jiggling with every step. Even Marlone felt exhausted just watching him.
Laiden was instantly annoyed. Elio was his brother’s only son, and he wouldn’t tolerate anyone mocking him. Marlone felt the same way about Arix, the only daughter of the Kering family, cherished and protected.
The tension between Laiden and Marlone was palpable, an invisible battlefield filled with hostile glares and a tense atmosphere.
"Stop it. Something’s not right," Solis said suddenly, his eyes sharp as he watched the video. His tone was cold and serious.
Laiden and Marlone were startled and immediately stopped bickering, looking at the video with concern.
"What do you mean, Solis?" Marlone asked seriously.
Everyone in the meeting room turned their attention to Solis, waiting anxiously for an explanation.
This test involved the heirs of five noble families and the students from the five military academies, so the exam had to be absolutely safe. Any mishap could have severe consequences, ones the Alliance couldn’t afford.
"Just now, our heirs, whether by accident or on purpose, all entered Celesterror territory. This can’t be a coincidence," Solis said, his voice filled with cold fury.
"Celesterrors would never let them enter like this. Normally, they would have been attacked by now. So, there can only be one explanation: the Celesterrors are facing a bigger problem!" Marlone’s voice was cold as ice. He immediately used his opticomputer to contact the soldiers near the Celesterror territory to check the situation.
The soldiers received the orders and rushed towards the Celesterror territory without delay. However, before they could enter, an invisible barrier threw them back. Ignoring their injuries, they quickly reported this to Marlone and the others.
"Bang!" Marlone slammed his fist on the table, his eyes filled with cold fury. "This is a grand scheme!"
Before the soldiers were thrown back, Marlone and the others saw what the barrier was. It was a massive psychic power shield, created by dozens of Supergiant-Class insectoids combining their psychic powers.
Even more alarming was that these were just the insectoids on the surface. The situation inside the Celesterror territory was likely even more severe.
The examiners from the military academies didn’t waste a moment. They immediately sent a distress call to the Fifth Legion for assistance.
At this moment, in the Celesterror territory...
"Arix," Cupid’s voice sounded worried in Arix’s mind.
Arix was walking at that time. She stopped and quickly asked in her mind, "Cupid, what’s wrong?"
"Arix, do we have to stay in the forest? I feel something uncomfortable here," Cupid said anxiously.
"What makes you feel uncomfortable?" Arix asked nervously.
"Bugs, a lot of bugs," Cupid, usually fearless, said with rare trembling and panic in his voice.
"Insects? Insectoids!" Arix’s pupils contracted as she finally understood.
"Yes, it’s them," Cupid nodded frantically.
"Okay, I understand." Arix’s gaze turned sharp and cold.
Then Arix directly tore off her digital bracelet, which immediately shocked Drexel and the others!
"Arix? What’s wrong?" Calista was the first to express her confusion, not understanding why Arix suddenly chose to quit.
"Arix, you know that taking off the bracelet means quitting," Drexel didn’t ask why because he trusted his sister wouldn’t do something like this for no reason.
"Why hasn’t the instructors shown up since I took off the bracelet?" Arix asked seriously.
Drexel and the others finally realized what she was doing. They took off their bracelets, but after waiting for a long time, there was no sign of the instructor or anything at all.
"Did something happen to the instructors?" Femi asked with wide, frightened eyes.
"I think something has happened to us. There might be a problem in this Celesterror territory," Drexel said with a serious expression, furrowing his brows.
"What should we do? Should we try to leave now?" Calista asked, looking worriedly at everyone.
"If we could leave, the instructors would be able to come in. I’m afraid we are already trapped. We need to contact the outside world and find out what’s going on," Drexel said coldly.
"Is there any way to contact them?" Arix asked Drexel, confused.
They didn’t have an opticomputer and couldn’t leave, so how could they contact anyone?
"There is a way," Drexel said. Then he took off his high boots and pulled out an opticomputer from his pants.
Arix’s eyes widened in surprise.
Dae-jung and the others were almost stunned.
"Pfft!" Arix couldn’t help but laugh despite the serious teammates.
"Drexel, you smuggled an opticomputer into the competition? If the instructors find out, they might take you out and skin you alive in fury," Femi said, eyes wide with surprise.
Femi silently prayed in his heart, hoping the instructors would go easy on Drexel after this was over.
Calista looked at the opticomputer, then at Drexel, repeating this a few times before finally accepting the reality that, the honorable and upright Drexel might actually be a troublemaker.
"Let’s not worry about how the opticomputer got here. Look, it’s coming in handy now," Drexel said, coughing awkwardly to justify bringing the opticomputer.
"Enough talk, just use it already," Arix couldn’t listen any longer and interrupted Drexel’s awkward conversation.
Drexel nodded, turned on the opticomputer, and called Marlone.

chapters.title: Chapter 89: Protecting An Egg
chapters.content:
Chapter 89: Protecting An Egg
The next moment, Marlone’s anxious face appeared on the 3D virtual screen.
"Drexel! Arix! How are you? Are you safe?" Marlone was surprised and worried to see his nephew calling.
"We’re fine for now," Arix’s image also appeared on the screen.
"We’re safe, but what’s going on? We seem to be trapped," Drexel asked, looking confused.
"The insectoids have surrounded the Celesterror territory. The Fifth Legion’s mecha team is on their way. Drexel, you must protect your sister and wait for rescue," Marlone instructed urgently.
"Okay. Also, please grant me access to the bracelet locations. I need to gather the students and protect them," Drexel said, revealing his other purpose.
"Alright, keep in touch," Marlone said before hanging up and sharing his instructor permissions with Drexel’s opticomputer.
As soon as Drexel received the permissions, he opened the digital bracelet location map. His face turned even grimmer.
He found out that the heirs of the five major families were all in Celesterror territory. The only good news was that there weren’t many other students.
"Arix, Dae-jung, Femi, Calista, I’ll go bring them here. You wait for me," Drexel said, considering everyone’s physical strength.
"Okay, be careful," Arix said, knowing her physical limitations, so she didn’t object.
Calista and the others understood and nodded in agreement.
After giving his instructions, Drexel disappeared without another word.
"Arix, will we be okay?" Calista asked fearfully, holding onto Arix’s arm.
"Don’t worry, I’ll protect you," Arix reassured her, holding her arm.
Calista’s eyes sparkled, her cheeks flushed, and she responded with a soft "Mm-hmm."
"Arix, don’t forget about me! Please protect me too!" Femi said tearfully.
Arix smiled and nodded, "You’re my teammates, so of course I’ll protect you."
Dae-jung, confident in his abilities, didn’t panic like the others. He kept a cool face and watched the surroundings warily.
But Arix suddenly realized she had forgotten someone. She quickly turned to Dae-jung and said, "Dae-jung, if you need it, I’ll protect you too."
Then she turned back, still worriedly watching the spot where Drexel had left.
Dae-jung hadn’t understood at first, but when he did, he felt a warmth in his heart.
The feeling of being protected by a companion seemed quite nice.
On the other side, after Drexel left, the first person he encountered was Elio, who was being chased by a wild beast.
Elio looked miserable. His clothes were torn by branches, and he had many cuts on his face and body.
The worst part was that he had to run for his life. The beast chasing him was only half a meter away. If he slowed down even a little, he would be caught and killed.
So, when Elio saw Drexel, he shouted excitedly, "Oh my god! Drexel! Help me!"
Drexel laughed at Elio’s pitiful appearance. Then he looked at the beast. He used his psychic power to create a long spear.
Drexel pushed off with his toes and leaped towards the beast, which was about to bite Elio.
At the critical moment, Drexel used the spear to knock the beast away. Then he jumped up, held the spear with both hands, and came down like a meteor, piercing the beast’s skull.
Elio, who was sitting on the ground and panting heavily, raised his hand to give a thumbs up and said, "Awesome, Drexel! That was cool!"
Drexel pulled the spear out of the beast and walked to Elio, helping him up. "Why are you in Celesterror’s territory? Don’t tell me you were chased in by this bear."
"This is Celesterror territory?? I didn’t mean to come here. This damn bear chased me, and I don’t even know where I am." Elio kicked the bear’s corpse, feeling a bit relieved.
’This unlucky guy, he always seemed to end up in trouble. Did he use up all his luck at birth?’
Drexel sighed silently.
Then he said, "I still have things to do. I can’t explain much. In short, we are surrounded by insectoids and can’t leave the Celesterror territory. Go straight this way for 1 kilometer; Arix is there. Wait for me there. I need to find Cirilla, Varden, and others. I’m leaving now."
After speaking, Drexel turned and left.
"Hey, wait! What do you mean we are surrounded by insectoids? Don’t joke about something so scary, okay?" Elio was almost going crazy. He didn’t want to believe it was true.
He had just escaped from a beast, and now there were insectoids.
’What was going on?’
Elio watched Drexel walk away, speechless.
In the end, he had to accept it and quickly ran in the direction Drexel had mentioned.
Meanwhile, Arix and the others were not having an easy time either. After Drexel left, they encountered several waves of insectoids. Just after dealing with one wave, they heard more noises coming from the bushes.
Arix and Dae-jung exchanged a glance. Then they all looked cautiously at the bushes.
"Don’t be scared, it’s me!" Elio said as he emerged from the bushes and saw them on high alert.
"Elio? Did you see Drexel?" Arix asked worriedly.
"He went to find Varden and the others. He told me to come find you. Don’t worry, Drexel is strong; he’ll be fine," Elio reassured.
"Thanks," Arix said, though his eyes still looked worriedly in the direction Drexel had gone.
At that moment, Drexel found the last three people he was looking for.
"Cirilla, Zephyr, Varden, are you okay?" Drexel asked, shocked at their miserable appearance.
Varden and the others were covered in blood, looking like soldiers who had fought for days and nights, and barely won.
"Don’t look at us like you’re ready to bury us. This blood isn’t ours. And why are you here?" Cirilla asked, holding a bright red egg.
"I came to find you. Let’s talk while we walk back; Arix is waiting for us," Drexel said, leading the way.
Without hesitation, Cirilla and the others followed Drexel back. On the way, Drexel briefly explained their situation.
Seeing Cirilla carefully holding the egg, Drexel raised an eyebrow and joked, "Cirilla, why are you carrying an egg? Are we having it for lunch?"
As expected, Cirilla rolled her eyes at Drexel. "This egg is the next Celesterror Lord. You can try eating it and see what happens."
"You mean this egg is the Celesterror King? How can it be so simple? An egg can become a Celesterror King?" Drexel’s eyes widened in shock.
He knew the egg Cirilla was holding was special but didn’t expect it to be a Celesterror Lord’s egg!
"The Celesterror Lord’s mate entrusted it to us. Do you think it’s a joke?" Cirilla said disdainfully.
"The Celesterror Lord’s mate entrusted it to you? What about the current Celesterror Lord? What happened to him and his family?" Drexel asked, frowning in confusion.
"Sigh, it’s probably because of this egg. I heard it has a problem with its innate psychic power, so the Celesterror Lord went out with some Celesterrors to find medicine, giving the insectoids a chance to attack," Cirilla said, feeling sad as she held the egg more tightly.
"Sigh," Drexel said, feeling much more down after hearing this. He stopped talking and focused on hurrying towards Arix’s location.
He knew his sister was also in danger. Thinking about this made Drexel’s heart race even faster, and his eyes turned red with worry.
’Arix! Wait for me!’
he thought, pushing himself to move even quicker.

chapters.title: Chapter 90: Meeting Quispe
chapters.content:
Chapter 90: Meeting Quispe
Arix saw many students that Drexel had saved came to her.
Luckily, the students seemed okay. They were not as scared as Arix had thought. Instead, they seemed like they were ready to face death.
"Arix, can we make it back home?" asked the most seriously injured student. He looked at Arix weakly and spoke in a hopeless voice.
The student’s hopeless eyes felt like a sharp, cold knife stabbing into Arix’s tender heart.
Arix pushed down his sadness. He patted the student’s head and said, "We will be out soon. The Fifth Legion has sent a mecha team to rescue us, so you must hold on, okay?"
"Okay, I will hold on, I will..." the student said. Then he closed his eyes and passed out.
Arix’s relaxed face turned serious after the student fainted. If the rescue didn’t come soon, this student wouldn’t make it. With severe internal bleeding and no medicine or special tools, even Arix couldn’t keep him alive much longer.
’What should we do now?’
Arix frowned, feeling unsure for the first time.
’What’s taken Drexel so long?’
Before she could check if Drexel had returned, Arix heard the students’ frightened screams.
"So many insectoids! Are we done for?" The students, though prepared to perish here, felt scared seeing so many huge insectoids.
This time, the insectoids didn’t attack immediately. Instead, they seemed organized. This didn’t make Arix feel better; it made her eyes widen in fear. This meant a stronger insectoid had appeared.
Organized insectoids were much harder to deal with than those they had met before.
"Look! Why is there a person on the insectoid’s head?" a student shouted, noticing something unusual.
The student’s voice made everyone curious. They all looked at the person.
’Is that really a person?’
A young man with blond hair and red eyes sat leisurely on the insectoid’s head. He looked incredibly handsome, with sharp features like a sculpture. His dark eyebrows and long, charming eyes were like a whirlpool, drawing everyone’s gaze inside. His high nose and perfectly shaped lips were now curved into a dazzling smile.
"I finally found my little lambs," the guy said with a strange, affectionate smile.
With his words, the air around became tense. Some knowledgeable students recognized the man immediately.
"Everyone, be careful! Don’t go near him, he’s an insectoid!" A student who recognized his identity shouted in terror.
"But he looks human," another student said, confused.
"He is the insectoid crown prince. Only insectoid royalty can turn into humans. This means his psychic power and physical power are at least Supergiant+," the warning student explained as her voice trembled more and more, filled with despair.
"We’re doomed. We’ll never make it to the rescue."
"The insectoid crown prince is here. Do we even have a chance to survive?"
"I haven’t even said goodbye to my family yet."
Listening to the students’ desperate words, Arix silently moved to the front. If they were going to die, she would protect these kids as long as possible.
Prince Quispe looked at the student who had identified him, propping his chin up with his hand and giving an encouraging smile. "I didn’t expect humans to be so smart. I even admire you a bit. As a reward, I grant you the honor of being food for my mount."
The student’s eyes filled with more fear, but remembering who she was now, she tried to stand calmly. She realized she was a military students, born to die with honor on the battlefield. Even if scared, she shouldn’t show weakness because she was the Alliance’s future soldier.
Their shaking legs wasn’t all fear; it was just a natural reaction.
"Boring. My people are hungry, so go to hell now," Quispe said, his voice devoid of any warmth. Then he waved his hand at the students. The insectoids, as if receiving a command, swarmed towards them.
Seeing this, Arix quickly raised a psychic barrier, protecting all the students underneath it.
"Look, it’s Arix! She’s the first to stand up when there’s danger. It’s so inspiring."
"Yeah, she treated all the injured ones just now, and now she is fighting to protect us. Let’s not give up! Come on!"
"Yes! Even if we die, we should take an insectoid down with us!"
Quispe watched the resisting students for a moment with interest. Then, he turned his gaze to the source of it all—a young woman, with sheer psychic power, held up a strong psychic barrier, resisting the entire insectoid attack.
The young woman was about the same age as him. Her skin was as smooth as silk, and her eyes were pure and endless, like the color of the clearest sky. Her cheekbones were so cute, and her black hair had natural waves and curves that made Quispe imagine the feel of it under his fingers.
Quispe’s eyes lit up as if he had found a toy he liked, his smile charming but twisted. He jumped down from his mount and walked elegantly toward Arix.
His blood-red eyes, slightly aggressive, stared at her for a moment. And then, his smile grew more satisfied, yet more dangerous too.
"You are powerful, and I respect strength. So I will make you my mate. This is my gift to a worthy opponent," Quispe said, looking at Arix like a noble god, both caring and disdainful.
Arix thought to herself,
’Who let this lunatic out? Someone please take him back immediately!’
"Woman, your look displeases me. You’ll be punished," Quispe said. Then, with a snap of his fingers, he shattered Arix’s mental barrier.
’What the heck?’
Arix’s pupils tightened. She looked at her hands in disbelief.
Her Supergiant+ psychic power had never been so thoroughly crushed before.
’So, just how terrifying is the power of this young man in front of me?’
"Your look finally pleases me," Quispe said with a contemptuous smile. He continued, "Although your psychic power is impressive, your physical power holds it back. If you agree to be my mate, I’ll help you raise your physical power to Supergiant. How about that?"
"Sorry, not interested. I don’t like bugs," Arix said, looking at Quispe with disgust.
Even though he was good-looking, it didn’t change the fact that he was a bug under a human shell.
Arix’s words and look completely angered Quispe. His red eyes narrowed, and he said coldly, "If you don’t want to be my mate willingly, then I’ll have to erase your memory and make you a puppet."
Arix felt completely at loss. She wanted to question God in face, asking why He sent such an overdramatic young man, trying to kill her with cringe.
Arix rubbed the goosebumps on her arms and glanced at her friends.
She saw them defending and attacking, not panicking even though the psychic barrier had disappeared.
The weight in Arix’s heart finally lifted. She breathed a sigh of relief and stared hard at Quispe. Then she clenched her fists, ready to move.
Quispe looked at the young woman’s angry eyes. This time, instead of getting angry, he became more interested in her.
Sure enough, having her lively like this was more to his liking than making her a puppet.
Arix didn’t waste any more words. She grabbed a dagger and rushed at Quispe. She attacked him several times but never touched him.
Supergiant physical power wasn’t just a number; his speed, strength, and endurance were far beyond Arix’s.

chapters.title: Chapter 91: A Furious Drexel
chapters.content:
Chapter 91: A Furious Drexel
Despite a few more failed attacks, Arix wasn’t frustrated. Her main goal was to buy time and wait for help.
If the young man in front of her got serious, Arix felt she had no chance of winning.
It wasn’t that Arix was too weak; it was that this young man was too strong—not just in physical power, but in psychic power too. Arix had no confidence in defeating him!
Quispe also saw through Arix’s plan, but he wasn’t in a hurry. It was like a cat playing with a mouse before eating it, watching it struggle in despair before slowly devouring it.
Prey tasted better that way.
Just as Quispe was having fun, another young man appeared next to him.
"Quispe, what are you doing? If you don’t kill them quickly, the Alliance’s army will arrive," a young man said angrily. He had the same eyes as Quispe’s, yet his hair was blue.
"I don’t need you to tell me what to do, Hardy," Quispe said, clearly annoyed. He despised Hardy even more than these prey he wanted to kill.
"Hmph!" Hardy, just an ordinary insectoid prince, didn’t dare to argue with Quispe, the crown prince. Instead, he directed his anger at Arix.
Quispe didn’t stop him but watched with interest.
Hardy attacked Arix directly. Using his psychic power, he slammed her to the ground. Then, his hands turned into sharp spikes, aiming to stab Arix.
Arix rolled away awkwardly, dodging the spikes. Before she could catch her breath, Hardy attacked again.
"Arix, let’s help you," Cupid said in the psychic world, feeling worried.
"No, wait. It’s not time yet," Arix refused. This young man, though tough, wasn’t as terrifying as Quispe.
From the very start, Arix was only wary of Quispe. He was incredibly strong and unpredictable, like a mad dog ready to attack at any moment.
Right now, Quispe was playing with her, treating her like a toy. If Cupid and the others revealed themselves, Quispe would likely kill them instantly, and Arix couldn’t stop him.
So, unless it was absolutely necessary, Arix couldn’t reveal Cupid and the others.
"Hardy, don’t kill her. She’s my new toy," Quispe warned casually.
Hardy laughed coldly and hit even harder. Soon, Arix was covered in wounds. She ended up lying on the ground, spitting blood.
The students watching wanted to help Arix, but the other insectoids stopped them.
"Arix, don’t worry about us. Just go," the helpless students cried.
They knew Arix could escape alone. She stayed to buy them time. But watching her get hurt was worse than getting physically tortured for them.
"Arix, leave! We don’t need you to save us," the students shouted.
"Arix, save yourself. Go!" Calista cried the loudest.
Elio cried and fought the insectoids, cursing them with every bad word he knew.
Dae-jung didn’t shout, but his hands were bloody from gripping his dagger too tightly, eyes filled with anger at the scene.
Hardy, hearing the desperate cries, became even more vicious, like he was fueled by their misery.
After Arix was kicked away again, Quispe finally said coldly, "Enough. If she dies, so do you."
Hardy reluctantly stopped, giving a final angry huff before standing still.
Quispe saw that Hardy had calmed down, so he took back his murderous glare. Then he looked at Arix, who was lying on the ground and unable to move.
Quispe walked over to Arix. He squatted down and grabbed her bruised and bleeding cheek. He asked again, "Will you be my mate now? If you agree, I can do something for you, like kill the person who just abused you."
Arix forced a smile, looking at Quispe with a cold expression. "No way!"
Quispe laughed angrily, his red eyes both charming and dangerous. He smirked and said, "Whether it’s possible or not is not up to you. You should at least accept the opportunity and have a try, how do you know you won’t like it without having a taste?"
Arix felt disgusted and turned her head, not wanting to see him anymore.
Quispe thought her silence meant she had accepted her fate, so he stood up, satisfied.
He snapped his fingers.
A transparent, spherical psychic power barrier surrounded Arix on the ground. Then, she floated beside Quispe.
Arix didn’t resist. Sitting quietly in the barrier, she wiped the blood from her mouth.
Seeing Arix so obedient pleased Quispe even more. He took out a Star-Class healing potion from his Space Button and threw it to her.
"Take care of your injuries first. After I kill these weaklings, I’ll take you back to our insectoid Empire," Quispe said softly, but his words were cruel.
Arix clenched her fists, suppressing her anger. She took the potion, opened it, checked it, and then gulped it down.
Now was not the time to be picky. Drinking the potion might give her a better chance to fight back.
"Cupid, Vita, Sophia, are you ready?" Arix silently asked.
"Yes!" The three little ones nodded seriously, concentrating.
With their combined psychic power, Arix finally manifested a real psychic weapon in her hand.
She shattered the psychic power barrier trapping her and, before Quispe could react, used all her strength to stab a scalpel into his heart.
But Quispe, who should have died, showed no sign of injury. Instead, he used his psychic power to throw Arix forcefully away.
’Impossible. How could this happen?’
Arix spat out blood, looking at Quispe in shock. She couldn’t understand why he wasn’t dead.
Quispe sneered and used his psychic power to bind Arix, lifting her into the air in front of him.
"Are you curious why I didn’t die?" Quispe drank a healing potion slowly, without any anger in his voice.
It was like a human being scratched by a cat or dog—would they get angry at the pet? Pets are so cute, of course they would forgive them. Quispe felt the same way, or maybe he was just a pervert. The more his "pet" resisted, the more excited he became.
Arix watched in horror as the wound she had inflicted with all her strength healed right before her eyes. She finally broke down a bit, glaring at Quispe and asking for the first time, "So, why aren’t you dead?"
Quispe laughed loudly.
When he finally stopped, he touched Arix’s cheek gently and said with pity in his voice, "Woman, your name is Arix, right? You are adorably foolish. With our level of psychic power, unless you can completely destroy all of it at once, you can’t kill us physically. If there is a real weak spot, it should be here."
Quispe pointed to his head with his slender finger.
Arix was speechless. Now she understood. Unless she killed him in one blow, he could heal from any injury quickly. But to kill him in one blow, she would have to destroy his psychic power. That seemed impossible.
Arix also had Supergiant+ psychic power, but her Star-Class physical body limited her strength. If she used her full psychic power, her body would be the first to break down.
So, she destroying Quispe’s psychic power was nearly impossible. She realized that if she had aimed for his head earlier, she might have at least severely injured him, even if he didn’t die.
Thinking about the missed opportunity, Arix felt a pang of regret. "How about I try again? This time, I promise to aim for your head?" she asked, trying to negotiate. Maybe this crazy insectoid man would foolishly agree.
Quispe laughed even harder, clutching his forehead.
"Arix, you are too adorable. I’m finding it harder and harder to want to kill you," Quispe said tenderly, touching the corner of Arix’s eye. His eyes were full of mad obsession.
Arix’s mouth twitched, and she was about to retort when she heard an enraged shout.
"Bastard, let go of my sister!" Drexel yelled, his heart breaking at the sight of his injured and tormented sister.
At that moment, Drexel lost all reason. He charged at Quispe like a madman, gripping his spear.
Quispe snorted and snapped his fingers, creating a psychic power shield that blocked Drexel’s attack. But to his surprise, the shield shattered the next moment.
Even Quispe looked at Drexel with a puzzled expression. "Another Supergiant+? No, you’re not. Then how did you break my psychic power shield?"
"Shut up! You dare to mistreat my sister? I’ll crush you!" Drexel roared in fury.
Seeing Arix’s terrible condition had pushed his anger to its limit. Each strike he aimed at Quispe carried terrifying power, as if a god of war had descended.

chapters.title: Chapter 92: Black Hole
chapters.content:
Chapter 92: Black Hole
Under Drexel’s relentless assault, even Quispe began to falter. With Arix by his side, he couldn’t unleash his full strength. Reluctantly, Quispe tossed Arix toward Hardy and ordered, "Take care of her."
Freed from worry, Quispe dove back into the intense battle with Drexel.
Hardy caught Arix, a sinister smile curling on his lips. Glancing at Quispe, who was locked in combat, he murmured, "Alright, my dear CROWN prince."
Arix noticed Hardy’s scheming look and felt a wave of dread.
"You’re Arix, right?" Hardy sneered.
"No, I’m not," Arix denied, shaking her head. "I’m Alexandra. Call me Alex."
"Ha! So many people just called you Arix. Do you think I’m deaf? It doesn’t matter if you are or not; today, you’re going to die anyway. This is a death order from the insectoid queen. You should feel honored." Hardy pulled out a strange crystal and threw it on the ground, creating a terrifying vortex instantly.
’A black hole? A real black hole that will reduce someone to nothing?’
Arix’s eyes widened in fear. She wanted to call for help, but before she could, Hardy clamped his hand over her mouth.
She struggled, yet her muffled cries going unnoticed.
Dae-jung, who had been trying to rescue Arix, was the first to notice something was wrong. He shouted, "Arix is in danger! Save her, quick!"
Both fighters halted, their eyes darting toward Arix.
"You damn bug! Let go of my sister!" Drexel was furious, itching to tear Hardy apart. But with Arix in Hardy’s grip, he dared not act recklessly.
"Hardy! Stop! I’ll crush you if you hurt her a bit!" Quispe saw the black hole and immediately understood Hardy’s plan.
Black holes were different from wormholes. Wormholes, though a kind of black holes, had established space passages built by the insectoids, making them safer. A black hole, however, was an undeveloped wormhole. Falling into it meant getting lost in the universe, and the space storms inside could shred a person to pieces, turning them into cosmic debris.
"Quispe, this is our mission! Don’t forget HER orders: extinguish the Alliance’s last hope. This woman is Arix Kering! Are you going to stop me now?" Hardy frowned, displeased, glaring at Quispe.
Thinking of the terrifying queen, Quispe’s eyes narrowed. But seeing Arix struggle, he couldn’t bear it. "Hand her over to me. I’ll take care of it myself."
Hardy hesitated, annoyed.
’Why haven’t I realized Quispe is such a lovesick fool before? If I had known, he wouldn’t have teamed up with him.’
Quispe was turning out to be a real liability.
Hardy, disgusted, stopped wasting time and prepared to shove Arix directly into the black hole.
Luckily, Cupid, Vita, and Sophia arrived just in time, knocking Hardy away in unison.
Arix, still bound, barely had time to breathe a sigh of relief before another insectoid appeared out of nowhere and crashed into her, sending her into the black hole.
Arix got desperate.
’So, dying today seems inevitable, huh?’
As Arix lost her balance, she managed a bitter smile. Just before being swallowed by the black hole, she thought she saw Cassian arriving with the Alliance forces. Yet, before she could be sure, the black hole engulfed her completely.
"Arix!!!" The three little ones screamed in terror, then, without hesitation, they jumped in after her.
"Arix!!!"
"Arix!!!"
Their heart-wrenching cries echoed through The Sugli Forest. Drexel, Dae-jung, Calista, Cirilla, Elio, and countless other students frantically lunged toward the black hole, trying to pull Arix back.
But the black hole closed the instant Arix fell in, as if it had completed its mission. No matter how quickly they moved, there was no chance to retrieve her once she was inside.
"Argh—" Drexel roared in agony, unable to believe this was happening. A black hole! There was no hope of surviving that!
His sister, who had just returned home...
’How am I losing her again? And this time, the odds of her surviving are so slim. Can I ever get her back?’
Driven mad, Drexel began furiously digging at the spot where the black hole had been, desperate to find it and follow Arix inside. He couldn’t bear thinking his gentle, kind sister alone in that dark, cold void.
Cassian, who had just arrived, stared in disbelief at the scene, his fury breaking through his rationality. He transformed instantly into a massive white werewolf, baring his fangs at the two insectoids. His huge golden eyes, once calm, now blazed with a murderous rage, fixed on Hardy.
Cassian raised his wolf head and let out an enraged howl. His enormous body did nothing to hinder his speed; instead, he moved like lightning toward Hardy.
Terrified, Hardy hastily put up a psychic power barrier, but no barrier, no matter how strong, could withstand absolute power. It shattered like glass under Cassian’s attack.
"Quispe! What are you standing there for? Save me!" Hardy, overwhelmed by Cassian’s terrifying presence, called out to his teammate for help.
Quispe, watching coldly from the side, also wanted to kill Hardy. But as an insectoid prince, Hardy’s death wasn’t something he could decide, no matter how much he deserved it.
Quispe raised a Supergiant+ psychic barrier to withstand Cassian’s attack. He then turned to Hardy, expressing his disgust. "Open a space portal and get us out of here now, do you really want to die here?"
"Fine." Hardy quickly took out a special crystal and crushed it. Instantly, a vortex resembling a black hole appeared beside them.
"Go!" Quispe commanded, grabbing Hardy and stepping into the vortex, disappearing from sight.
Cassian could only watch helplessly as the two insectoids responsible for Arix’s demise vanished. Overwhelmed with fury, he spat out a mouthful of blood and instantly reverted to his small white wolf form, plummeting from the air.
Duke Glendale arrived just a bit too late. Catching Cassian with urgency, he let out a helpless sigh and said, "Oh boy, Your Highness! You’re not even healed yet, and here you are in another fight. How am I going to explain this to His Majesty when you return half-dead?"
"Save her..." Cassian managed to whisper before slipping into unconsciousness.
"Alright, alright, save her. Got it. You just rest now. Finding someone who fell into a wormhole? That’s right up my alley," Duke Glendale replied, rolling his eyes as he thought of something.
Cassian wanted to say more, but his severe injuries rendered him completely unconscious. The wounds from his last wormhole incident had never fully healed, and using his psychic powers twice in the past month had worsened his condition greatly.
Holding the small wolf cub, Duke Glendale sighed and remarked, "They say deep love shortens one’s life. You lovers sure know how to wear yourselves out."
"Your Grace, we’ve wrapped things up with the Alliance. Should we head back to the Empire now?" Kasem, the butler, asked respectfully.
"Back to the Empire? Not a chance! Kasem, look at this little wolf cub. He risked his life twice for the Alliance. We can’t return empty-handed; that would be a huge loss," Duke Glendale said, looking at Kasem like he was a fool.
Kasem, caught off guard by the Duke’s shamelessness, quickly shifted to an expression of admiration. "As expected, Your Grace, always so wise."
With a satisfied smirk, Duke Glendale, carrying the wolf cub, started walking towards the edge of the forest, muttering, "I’ve heard the Alliance recently developed a psychic power healing potion. We can’t miss out on that. Let’s go check it out."
"Yes, Your Grace," Kasem replied.
The joint training competition of the five military academies was cut short due to an insectoid invasion. This incident left one student missing and dozens severely injured. Fortunately, the advanced medical technology of the interstellar era saved the injured students.
Despite these efforts, there was no joy among the students or instructors. The missing student, Arix, was still unaccounted for, and hopes of finding them alive were slim.
The second greatest victim in this ordeal was probably Arix’s brother, Drexel, who had to return home for mandatory rest due to his mental state. He’d be home until the Hecaris Military Academy reopened.

chapters.title: Chapter 93: Two Arixes
chapters.content:
Chapter 93: Two Arixes
The training base was shrouded in gloom.
At the emergency meeting called by the Alliance President, the expressions of the five Admirals were grim.
"As is customary, whenever a hero of the Alliance sacrifices their life, the Memorial Hall will officially publish their life experiences and achievements. We are holding this meeting to ask everyone whether we should announce Arix’s story," Zeta asked, breaking the heavy silence as he looked at the five somber admirals.
"It doesn’t matter to me," Matis responded. His usual vigor was gone, his silver hair more pronounced. Since learning his granddaughter had fallen into the black hole, Matis seemed to have aged years overnight.
"Announce it. There are a lot of rumors on the interstellarnet. It’s time to clear Arix’s name," Mael, holding traditional views, emphasized the importance of reputation.
"Those who spread rumors should be sentenced or at least, fined. Charge them with insulting a military martyr," Fane said coldly. Slandering military martyrs is a severe crime in the Alliance. That suggestion showed how much Fane cherished Arix.
"I also suggest that the military file lawsuits against these people to hold them legally accountable. These individuals enjoy the peace brought by others’ sacrifices yet fail to appreciate it. Many of them hide in dark corners, judging others with the darkest of worldviews," Sykes added, clearly displeased.
"Huh, they think they can escape by hiding in dark corners. I’ve already gathered their information. Zeta, it’s up to you now," Virek said, handing over a thick stack of documents to Zeta.
Zeta skimmed through the documents, his eyes sharp. "I’ll discuss with the judicial department on how to deal with these irresponsible people," he declared. The five admirals trusted Zeta; with him taking action, these rumor-mongers would at least face severe consequences.
After the meeting, the Alliance released three headlines on the interstellar net.
The first headline announced that any future comments insulting martyrs or soldiers could be subject to legal action. This was well-received by the people of the Alliance.
Some accounts continued to make jokes about Arix’s sacrifice, but investigations revealed that these account holders were not from the Alliance. Most people simply laughed it off and moved on.
The second headline detailed Arix’s life and contributions to the Alliance. It was then that people discovered that Drexel and Arix, whom they had shipped as a couple, were actually siblings. This revelation shocked many fans who had supported the pair, leaving them in disbelief.
Soon, sharp-eyed netizens noticed that Arix was also the researcher behind the psychic power healing potion.
However, before everyone could fully celebrate the revelation of Arix as a potion genius, the third interstellarnet headline dropped: "Yesterday, in the Sugli Forest, Arix sacrificed herself to save numerous classmates from an insectoid massacre. She delayed the attackers long enough for others to escape but ultimately fell into a black hole and are now tragically missing."
Falling into a black hole was effectively a death sentence.
In the entire history of the Alliance, no one who had fallen into a black hole had ever returned alive.
Realizing this, those people, who had been following the story, felt as if they had been struck by a thunderbolt.
Upon seeing the final headline, many people couldn’t hold back their tears. After almost crying their eyes out, a large number of Alliance citizens spontaneously went to the guarded outskirts of the Sugli Forest to lay flowers for Arix.
The compassionate people of the Alliance used these flowers to express their tribute and sorrow for the martyr Arix.
Chapter 105 Two Arixes
While the world outside mourned the loss of Arix, inside the black hole, a young woman was busy giving Arix a piece of her mind.
"Hey, Raya! How long are you going to sleep? I don’t have much time left!" an irate female voice echoed.
Arix groggily opened her eyes to see her past life’s face, clearly upset. Still dazed, Arix stared blankly for a few seconds before letting out a piercing scream that echoed through the black hole.
"What the hell? Where am I? Help!" Arix shouted, trying to run but finding herself unable to move. She was trapped in a transparent spherical barrier, forced to watch her past self slowly approach.
Cupid, equally confused, joined in the screaming and attempted to flee, while Vita and Sophia remained calmly squatting in place.
"Don’t come any closer! I’m warning you, come any closer and I’ll fight back!" Arix yelled, on the verge of a breakdown.
"Raya, are you out of your mind? You’ve been in my body for so many years, and you’re still this scared of me?" "Arix" looked at her with disdain, her tone full of irritation.
"What are you talking about? When was I in your body for ten years?" Arix’s eyes widened with fear, tears welling up as she hugged Cupid. Both human and tiger looked pathetically innocent, as if the young woman before them was some kind of villain, and they were her persecuted victims.
"Hah!" "Arix" scoffed, pointing to her own face. "I’m Arix, got it?"
"Got it!" Arix and Cupid nodded fearfully, but Arix quickly realized something was off and shook her head. "Wait, no, I’m the real Arix. Have I missed my past life so much that I’ve developed a split personality?"
"Arix" closed her eyes in exasperation and took a deep breath. Then, she delivered a swift blow to Arix’s head, shouting, "You are Raya Kering, and I am Arix Vetti! Got it now? If not, I’ll fix that for you."
"Ouch, ouch, ouch!!" Arix cried, clutching her head where a lump had formed. She squatted down, looking pitifully at "Arix". But seeing her angry eyes, Arix quickly nodded, still tearful. "Got it, I got it. But why have we switched places? And how are we seeing each other now?"
Arix’s question actually stumped "Arix", who wasn’t quite sure either. Seeing "Arix" momentarily quieted down, Arix sighed in relief. She quickly scooped up Vita and Sophia, asking with concern, "Vita, Sophia, are you two okay?"
"We’re fine," Vita and Sophia reassured her, shaking their heads adorably as they nestled in Arix’s arms. Then, glancing at the other "Arix", they whispered, "Arix, she doesn’t seem like a bad person. It looks like she means no harm to you. And, we might have been saved because of her."
Arix looked curiously at the young woman before her and then finally took in her surroundings. They were still inside the black hole, but the spherical barrier seemed to be keeping them safe. This odd barrier could only have been created by the other "Arix".
Feeling a bit embarrassed, Arix cleared her throat. It felt awkward saying her own name out loud like that. Meanwhile, the other "Arix", having gathered her thoughts, asked seriously, "Did you receive incomplete memories? How could you forget that you are Raya?"
Arix was taken aback. She indeed had no memories from before she was five. She had always assumed it was a normal part of growing up. But now that the other "Arix" mentioned it, something seemed off.
’If I was really Raya and had changed my name, how could I not remember something so big?’
Moreover, what the other "Arix" said couldn’t be a lie. The girl standing before her was in her psychic incarnation form, and she looked exactly like her past self, which means she was the original owner of the Arix Vetti body.
Psychic Incarnations reflected one’s soul, and while physical appearances could be faked, the soul’s appearance could not.
Despite the strangeness of the situation, Arix found it oddly natural. Then, another question arose: If she really was the interstellar Raya, why had she traveled to the modern world and lost these memories?
"I really don’t have any memories from before I was five. So, I’ve always thought I WAS Arix Vetti. Do you remember how you ended up in the interstellar era?" Arix asked, her curiosity piqued.
The other Arix’s expression grew serious as she pinched her chin, thinking for a moment before replying, "I don’t know why it happened. One day, I suddenly found myself in the interstellar era, waking up in your body, a girl that was younger than me. I was afraid your family would notice something was off. Also, there was a maid who tried to kidnap me, so I let her take me. Once I was out of the Kering family, I knocked her out and hid in a garbage transport ship to escape."
"Wait, wait, hold on. You let her kidnap you on purpose?" Arix was stunned. She hadn’t expected such a bold move from the other "Arix". A normal person’s reaction would be just to pretend to have amnesia or lay low for a while.
The other "Arix" gave Arix a stare. After getting back to the modern world and absorbing Arix’s memories of the time when she was absent, she couldn’t help comparing their lives. Seeing Arix’s life, surrounded by love, and then looking at her own, where she had to scavenge through garbage to survive, "Arix" did feel some regret, and jealousy.
However, the interstellar era was different from the modern age, especially with the added complication of psychic powers. Arix’s own psychic power was so low it was embarrassing. If she were to have her psychic power tested, it would be game over. So, leaving the Kering family might not have been the worst thing.
With this in mind, "Arix" found peace with her situation. Despite scavenging on Planet Waste for ten years, she had ultimately gained something valuable. She hated studying chemistry, but after the switch, she not only had all of Arix’s chemistry knowledge but also a natural aptitude for it.
It was like suddenly acquiring a magical medical cheat code—an undeniably thrilling advantage.

chapters.title: Chapter 94: Gene Lock
chapters.content:
Chapter 94: Gene Lock
During the ten more years she had stayed in the interstellar era, "Arix" has gained a lot of knowledge about mecha technology. After returning, she wasted no time in setting up her own arms company.
Today, she’s a renowned mecha expert in the 21st-century world. When she steps out, she’s always flanked by more than a dozen guards for protection.
With her ambition, building a spaceship and migrating to other planets might soon be within reach. It’s possible that the next leap in interstellar travel could be driven by her innovations.
...
Realizing her time here was limited, "Arix" quickly moved to the main task.
"Raya, I don’t have much time. This time, I’m here on an old man’s orders," "Arix" began, cutting Raya off before she could ask, "I don’t know who he is, so don’t ask."
Raya felt a strange sense of familiarity, as if "Arix" could read her mind. She hadn’t even asked yet, but the answer was already given.
"Alright, then at least tell me what he sent you here to do," Raya said, resigned and curious.
"To unlock your gene lock," "Arix" replied with a serious tone.
"Gene lock? Isn’t that for treating genetic diseases? I haven’t noticed any gene lock in me," Raya said, completely baffled. She even used her psychic power to scan herself again but found nothing.
Gene locks are typically used to manage DNA fusion issues arising from hereditary problems or other reasons. Usually, only those with close-relative marriages or problematic parental combinations, like ligers, would have their genes specifically locked.
If an ordinary person locked their genes for no reason, at best, they might not grow tall, go bald, have a flat chest, or be short. At worst, they’d be prone to cancer and hereditary diseases.
Even in the 21st century, modifying a baby’s genes is strictly prohibited, let alone in the interstellar era.
Raya shook her head in confusion, sayhing, "Why don’t we just try unlocking it first? Maybe something will come to you."
"Alright," "Arix" agreed, though reluctantly.
"And Cupid, Vita, Sophia, you should return to my psychic world for now. We’re about to start," Raya said, her expression softening as she addressed the three little ones in her arms.
"Okay," they replied in unison. Then they transformed into streams of psychic power and returned to Raya’s psychic world.
Once everything was set, "Arix" gently cupped Raya’s face and pressed their foreheads together.
"Isn’t this a bit unscientific? Gene locks aren’t supposed to be opened like this," Arix mumbled, feeling the warmth on her forehead and suddenly feeling awkward.
"Shut up! You’ve already time-traveled, and you’re still talking to me about science?" "Arix" snapped, a symbol of irritation flashing on her forehead.
Feeling helpless, Raya closed her mouth, then her eyes, and waited quietly.
After a short while, a blinding white light suddenly burst forth from between the foreheads of the two young women.
Arix felt as if her entire body was ablaze, something within her breaking free from a cage. She opened her eyes in agony and saw that "Arix" was gradually becoming transparent.
"What’s happening to you?" Arix asked, her concern cutting through the pain.
"It’s nothing, just my time running out. It’s time to say goodbye," "Arix" said with a calm smile, as if she had anticipated this moment.
While "Arix" seemed serene, Arix was filled with reluctance. The pain in her body intensified, making her throat so raw that she couldn’t even speak. She could only reach out weakly, trying to grasp "Arix."
"Arix" spoke in a proud yet slightly playful tone, "Raya, I always thought my time-traveling was just an accident. But on the night I died, a mysterious elder appeared next to my corpse—or rather, your corpse. I couldn’t see his face clearly, but he seemed to be praying for a long time. Then, your soul returned to this body. After that, I don’t know what happened. He only instructed me to unlock the gene lock in your body if I ever returned to the interstellar era. After that, he sent me back to the present. Although that old man was a bit aloof, I’m still grateful to him."
Hearing this, Arix felt a mix of emotions. But at that moment, she didn’t care about any old man. She only knew that this newfound friend was about to leave before they had even gotten to know each other well.
"Arix" reached out, wanting to ruffle Arix’s hair one last time, but her hand couldn’t make it. "And thank you for taking care of Sister Gwen and the others. Although we just met and now have to say goodbye, I want to say, Arix, it’s been a pleasure meeting you."
"Arix" then disintegrated into fragments, like data being deleted, and vanished completely.
Tears streamed down Arix’s face, the pain and sadness indistinguishable. With a hoarse voice, she whispered to the empty space where "Arix" had been, "It was a pleasure meeting you too."
Arix then could no longer withstand the excruciating pain and fainted. In the end, within the dark and perilous void, only a transparent light sphere enveloped Arix, directionless and uncertain of where it would go next.
At this moment, within the Empire...
Inside the grand and sacred Moon Goddess Temple, an elderly man, dressed in the Pontifex’s attire—a white robe trimmed with gold—sat cross-legged on a meditation cushion. He was deep in prayer before the massive statue of the Moon Goddess.
Perhaps because he had devoted his entire life to faith, the old man seemed to emanate a divine aura. His appearance was kind and wise, yet his eyes betrayed a cold indifference toward the world.
However, the moment Raya’s gene lock was unlocked, the Pontifex’s prayer abruptly halted. He slowly opened his eyes, and a hint of emotion finally appeared in his gaze.
"Moon Goddess, should I intervene?" Vezgor murmured, his expression complex.
Years ago, for the sake of his granddaughter—his daughter’s daughter—he had broken his own rules and altered her fate of certain death. Now, his granddaughter was once again in peril, trapped in a dangerous black hole. His rational mind told him to remain uninvolved.
But the anxious beating of his heart mocked his self-deception.
For the first time, the Pontifex, who usually felt at peace, was unsettled. He closed his eyes and prayed again. It seemed as though he received some sort of message, and his expression relaxed.
"Thank you, Moon Goddess. I understand." The Pontifex closed his eyes once more and resumed his prayer, now with a heart free of distractions.
In a hidden forest of the Empire, a beautiful meteor streaked across the early morning sky.
Mama Tiger, who was crouched down to drink water, lifted her head. Her eyes sparkled with curiosity as she watched the meteor glide by.
After the meteor had vanished, Mama Tiger drank her fill. Then she picked up the wild rabbit she had caught earlier and started heading back to her den.
She wondered if her cubs were hungry since she had been out hunting longer than usual.
Upon returning to the cave, Mama Tiger checked the entrance, covered with grass and stones. She felt relieved seeing that neither humans nor animals had disturbed it.
Using her paws, she moved aside the grass and stones, then squeezed through the small entrance.
Inside the spacious cave, Mama Tiger shook out her fur. She carried the prey to her cubs’ nest.
Seeing her cubs still asleep, Mama Tiger’s heart softened. She let out a gentle growl to wake them for breakfast.
Before dividing the food, Mama Tiger habitually counted her cubs.
One cub, two cubs, three cubs, four cubs, five cubs...
’Wait a minute. There’s an extra cub today.’
Mama Tiger nodded happily but then suddenly froze.
There was an extra one!
ONE EXTRA!
EXTRA!
The prey dropped from her mouth in shock. She instinctively used her furry paws to clutch her face in horror. Her powerful jaw, which had taken many lives, was now dropping and silently screaming.
Her expression resembled Edvard Munch’s famous painting, "The Scream."
After a moment, Mama Tiger snapped out of it and counted again. The result was still the same—one extra cub.
Her expression grew serious. She bent down and carefully inspected the cubs in the nest.
Among the adorable cubs, she found one that was different.
This sleeping cub had a pair of small wings and pure white fur with black stripes.
Most strikingly, there was a golden emblem on its forehead, making it look noble and mysterious.
With semi-circular ears and what looked like golden eye makeup around its eyes, this cub appeared both divine and incredibly cute.
By the end of her inspection, Mama Tiger’s stern eyes softened, charmed by this adorable cub.
It wasn’t that she was too weak; it was that this "ferociously cute" newcomer was too irresistible.
After being mesmerized for a moment, Mama Tiger quickly shook her head.
’No, this isn’t the time to get lost in thought. Where is this strange little cub come from? And why does she have wings? Is she abandoned because of them? Or maybe... maybe my husband has a secret affair with some birdie and left this cub with me?’
Mama Tiger’s expression turned fierce. Regardless of whether her guess was right or wrong, she’d give Daddy Tiger a good thrashing when he got back.
But now, the most pressing issue was what to do with this little cub.
Mama Tiger picked up the cub with her paw, deep in thought.
Arix woke up in this situation.

chapters.title: Chapter 95: Blessing of the Moon Goddess
chapters.content:
Chapter 95: Blessing of the Moon Goddess
As soon as she opened her eyes, she found herself being held by a very large, very fierce-looking tiger.
Her just-awakened brain hadn’t started working properly, and she thought she was about to be eaten. Her eyes welled up with tears, and she started crying out, "Awoo awooo! (Help! There’s a big tiger!)"
Realizing that something was off with her voice, Arix tried to say "Good morning," but what came out was a babyish "awoo."
Arix raised her furry paw and finally noticed something—she seemed to have turned into a little tiger.
This realization made Arix cry even harder, her big blue eyes welling up with huge tears.
’Will I never turn back into a human? Will I never see Grandpa, Dad, Mom, Drexel, and Sims again?’
The more she thought about it, the sadder she got, and she almost cried herself into a stupor.
Mama Tiger’s heart broke watching the little cub cry. She hurriedly put Arix back into the nest and awkwardly tried to comfort her by licking her furry cheek.
After licking away Arix’s tears, Mama Tiger nudged her little face with her big tiger head.
Though Mama Tiger’s attempts at comfort were clumsy, Arix still felt warmed.
She slowly stopped crying, though she still looked quite downcast.
Mama Tiger, seeing Arix listless, thought she might be hungry. She divided the big rabbit into five portions, giving the best rabbit leg to Arix.
Then, she called the other four cubs. As soon as they saw the food, they immediately started eating, not noticing anything unusual about having an extra sibling.
Mama Tiger watched her cubs eat with happiness, but when she saw Arix not eating, she softly growled, "Awoo, awoo? ( why aren’t you eating?)"
Arix could understand Mama Tiger, so when she heard the question, she looked up at her, then glanced at the food in front of her.
Although her stomach was growling with hunger, the sight of the bloody rabbit leg made her lose all appetite.
"I don’t want to eat..." Arix whimpered weakly.
Mama Tiger looked at Arix with a mix of indulgence and helplessness. She nudged the rabbit leg closer to Arix with her nose and said, "You can’t be picky eaters, or they won’t grow strong."
Arix felt a bit conflicted under Mama Tiger’s doting gaze, but then she noticed some kale nearby. Her eyes lit up. She got up from the nest and hopped over to the greens, starting to nibble on them.
Mama Tiger’s jaw dropped again.
In her entire life, this was the first time she had seen a tiger cub eat vegetables. Watching Arix eat so happily, Mama Tiger was at a loss for words.
After thinking for a moment, Mama Tiger ran out of the cave. She returned shortly, carrying several large apples. She dropped them next to Arix, who looked up in surprise.
The apple caught the eyes of the four cubs nearby. They sniffed them curiously.
Not detecting food they wanted, lay back down and resumed sleeping.
"Come and eat this," Mama Tiger softly growled, directing her words to Arix.
Arix, nibbling on some greens, heard Mama Tiger and turned. She instantly spotted the large apple.
"Wow, big apples!" she exclaimed with a delighted growl.
She dashed to the apple, hugged it, and began to gnaw happily. The sweet taste was a delightful change from the bitter greens.
Satisfied and full, Arix soon felt drowsy. Her little head began to nod off.
Mama Tiger, seeing this, gently picked Arix up and placed her back in the nest, nestling her among the other cubs.
Surrounded by a soft, cozy environment, Arix, now asleep, stretched lazily. She nestled her head against the other cubs and drifted into a deep, comfortable sleep.
"Wow, Arix looks just like us now. I almost didn’t recognize her."
"Yeah, she really does. It’s like we have an extra little sibling."
"That’s how she’s supposed to look. Nothing strange about it."
In her dreams, Arix heard familiar voices nearby. Groggily, she opened her eyes and didn’t see Mama Tiger. Instead, she found Cupid and the others sitting in a row, watching her.
Arix paused, then with a delighted growl, she leaped toward the three little ones.
"Seeing you all makes me feel so much better. I thought I had traveled through time again," Arix said, her growls full of relief.
"Don’t worry. Here, let me give you a pat," Cupid said, raising a tiny paw to pat Arix.
Vita, smiling gently, watched the two adorable cubs and joined in, patting them both.
Sophia, in the middle, got squeezed and rolled her eyes, but she stayed silent. After all, sharing life and death experiences together made even the proudest more tolerant.
After some playful moments, Arix finally calmed down. She looked at the three little ones and asked, "By the way, how did I turn into a little tiger? Sophia, do you know?"
"The little tiger has always been your animal form. It was just sealed away before. The other ’Arix’ helped you unlock your gene lock, which is like unsealing it," Sophia replied casually.
"Can I turn back into a human?" Arix asked nervously.
Sophia nodded first, then shook her head, making Arix feel all jittery inside. Even her four little paws started to tremble.
’If I can’t turn back into a human, what will happen to me? I’m such a cute little tiger, what if some male tiger takes me away to be a captive mate when I grow up? What then? No way! I can’t accept the idea of a human-animal romance!’
The more Arix let her imagination run wild, the more she felt like a tiny cabbage in a field, small and vulnerable, always worrying about being devoured by a wild boar.
Seeing Arix’s expressions switch between indignation and terror, Sophia quickly caught on. She interrupted, "Of course, you can turn back into a human, but there’s a condition. You need the Moon Goddess’s blessing. Right now, you’re like a therian cub, and in the Empire, a therian cub who hasn’t received the Moon Goddess’s blessing can’t shift to human form."
"Then what are we waiting for? Let’s go find the Moon Goddess!" Arix’s eyes lit up with determination.
"It’s not that simple. To receive the Moon Goddess’s blessing, you need to participate in the Empire’s Pontifex’s annual blessing ceremony. As a lone cub, you can’t join the ceremony unless you find a therian willing to adopt you and take you there," Sophia explained, looking a bit troubled.
It seemed impossible for them to find someone in this remote wilderness. And, convincing them to help Arix would be another challenge.
What Sophia was thinking about, Arix was considering too.
Sitting on the ground, she propped her chin up with her paw and pondered. Maybe she could learn from the stray cats from her previous life and try to play cute and helpless to get adopted.
Or she could pretend to be an abandoned cub and lie at someone’s doorstep, looking pitiful and innocent to solicit adoption.
As a last resort, she could join the Empire’s orphanage and receive the blessing with other orphaned therian cubs.
Thinking these ideas were good, Arix decided to set off. Her parents and brothers were probably still worried about her, so the sooner she set off, the sooner she could contact them.
However, just as she was about to leave, an image of Mama Tiger flashed through her mind. Arix hesitated and stopped, turning to Cupid and the others. "Let’s wait a bit. After saying goodbye to Mama Tiger, we’ll set off."
Cupid and the others agreed without much fuss and nodded. Seeing the tiger cubs awake, they went over to play with them. Despite being cubs themselves, they tried to pet the other cubs.
Arix sat at the cave entrance, smiling as she watched the seven cubs playfully tussling with each other. But as they waited, instead of Mama Tiger, two poachers arrived.
"Yep, this is the cave. I saw that Celesterror Tiger coming in and out of here every day. There must be cubs inside. If we catch them and sell them, we’ll make a fortune," a sleazy-looking middle-aged man said.
"Good, then what are we waiting for then? The tiger just left not long ago. Let’s hurry and grab the cubs inside," another voice, greedy and impatient, urged.
Arix’s heart raced. She knew they had to act quickly. She signaled to Cupid and the others to stay quiet and move back into the shadows of the cave. They needed to protect the cubs and themselves until Mama Tiger returned.
"Stay close," Arix whispered, her voice steady despite the fear bubbling inside her. "We’ll figure out a plan."
Cupid, Vita, and Sophia nodded, their faces serious. They huddled together, ready to defend their new family against the threat that loomed just outside the cave.
Arix’s eyes turned icy at the poachers’ words. When she looked toward the cave entrance, even her little tiger fangs were bared.
"Arix, what’s wrong?" Cupid and the others noticed her unusual state and asked worriedly.
"Poachers! They’re here to catch the tiger cubs," Arix said, her voice laced with fierce determination.
Not only did she despise poachers, but Mama Tiger had shown her kindness. There was no way she would let anyone harm these tiger cubs!

chapters.title: Chapter 96: Fighting The Poachers
chapters.content:
Chapter 96: Fighting The Poachers
Hearing Arix’s words, the three little ones got instantly furious, even Sophia’s face turned cold.
"I’m so mad! These bad guys, Arix, let’s go! Let’s go out and beat them up!" Cupid said, baring his teeth in anger.
"No, Cupid, I’ll go. You all go back to my psychic world," Arix replied, shaking his head.
"Why? They’re not like the insectoid crown prince, why should we be afraid of them?" Cupid felt extremely upset.
"Cupid, listen to Arix. We are Psychic Incarnations. If we show up in front of therian, it will reveal that we’re from the Alliance, and that would definitely cause trouble for Arix. You wouldn’t want that, right?" Vita comforted Cupid, gently patting his head.
Only those from the Alliance could have Psychic Incarnations. In the Empire, therian ranked by the purity of their bloodline. The purer the bloodline, the higher the talent. For example, royalty like Cassian, a pureblood of the werewolf clan, had both psychic and physical powers of Supergiant+ Class. But even Cassian could never have a Psychic Incarnation. As for why Empire people didn’t have Psychic Incarnations, scientifically, it was likely due to a missing gene in therian. Only their Creator knew why.
Hearing Vita’s explanation, Cupid could only nod, feeling dejected.
"Arix, be careful. If you can’t handle it, call us out," Cupid reminded Arix, still worried.
"Alright, thanks, Cupid," Arix felt warm inside, smiling and nodding in reassurance.
After the three little ones went back, Arix’s smile faded, his eyes turning icy as he looked outside. Not waiting for the two poachers to come in, Arix walked out directly. He didn’t want to damage Mama Tiger’s cave during the fight.
The two poachers, one tall and one fat, didn’t expect a cub to walk out on its own. They both grinned, like two creeps suddenly seeing a stunning beauty walking towards them.
"Oh my, this fur, those eyes, and that golden emblem. We’re going to make a fortune! If we take it to the auction, we can easily get at least a billion credits," the skinny poacher couldn’t wait, rubbing his hands, ready to grab Arix and live the high life.
"Yeah, but why does she have wings? That doesn’t look much like a Celesterror, more like a therian cub. I remember the Tiger clan, whose patriarch is part of the Empire’s Pontifex, they have wings too," the other poacher, Elio, hesitated.
While the Empire also forbid capturing wild Celesterrors, the punishment wasn’t severe, usually just a fine. But kidnapping therian cubs was a different matter. It wasn’t something that fines or jail time can resolve. At worst, it’s a lifetime of mining on a remote planet, at best, it’s immediate execution.
"What are you afraid of? So what if it’s a therian cub? We’re in the middle of nowhere. Even if we sell it, no one will find out. Don’t forget, the Empire isn’t above selling therian cubs. And think about it, this cub is worth at least a hundred billion credits," the skinny poacher, driven mad by greed, argued, his eyes bloodshot with frenzy.
The fat poacher, initially hesitant due to his concerns, was gradually swayed by the skinny one’s words. His eyes also started to show a crazed glint. Right, if no one found out, he could make a hundred billion credits too. As long as no one discovered it, everything would be fine.
The clarity in the fat poacher’s eyes was gradually replaced by greed, and the abyss of desire devoured his soul.
Arix, who initially only wanted to teach them a lesson, felt a murderous intent rising within. These two wretched individuals were, in some ways, worse than the insectoids. The evil of the insectoids was straightforward; they openly stated their intention to eat you. But these two hid behind a human facade, committing acts worse than beasts.
Letting evil people go was no better than harming others directly. So, Arix didn’t hold back anymore. The terrifying psychic power transformed into two mental spikes, stabbing into the two poachers’ brains.
However, Arix couldn’t bring herself to end their lives. Instead, she destroyed their brain areas, rendering them brainless for life. Only by some future chance might they recover, but by then, Arix was sure they would have suffered enough to atone for their sins.
After dealing with the two, Arix used her psychic power to bind them and tossed them far into the forest, as trash belongs in the trash can. If there was no trash can, then at least throw it far away, out of sight.
After all this, Arix returned to the cave, obediently waiting for Mama Tiger.
Around noon, Mama Tiger finally returned with two preys in her mouth.
As soon as she entered the cave, Mama Tiger saw Arix, seemingly waiting for her, and her heart instantly felt touched.
She put down the preys. Feeling her mouth filthy, she didn’t lick Arix but gently rubbed her massive head against Arix.
"What’s wrong, cub? Did you miss Mama?" Mama Tiger had completely accepted Arix as her own cub, her tone filled with motherly love.
Arix nodded obediently, rubbing her head against Mama Tiger’s leg. Then she howled, "Some bad people came earlier, trying to take us. Luckily, someone I don’t know chased them away."
Hearing this, Mama Tiger was startled. She quickly checked her cubs to make sure none were missing, then sighed in relief. She then howled to Arix, "Cub, wait here for Mama. I’ll go check outside."
After speaking, Mama Tiger darted outside and indeed found human footprints near the cave. Her eyes immediately turned fierce. She sniffed the scent left by the footprints, her gaze full of killing intent. Then she quickly ran into the nearby forest.
"Roar!" Mama Tiger let out a thunderous roar and charged in the direction of the two poachers. When she returned, there were clear traces of blood at the corners of her mouth.
Seeing the blood on Mama Tiger’s mouth, Arix could already guess the misery of the two men. However, she felt no remorse. In this world, you’d eventually face the consequences of your actions. Those who brought it upon themselves deserved no sympathy from Arix.

chapters.title: Chapter 97: Goodbye Mama Tiger
chapters.content:
Chapter 97: Goodbye Mama Tiger
When Mama Tiger returned, she spotted Arix waiting at the cave entrance. Not wanting to scare her with the blood on her mouth, she quickly turned to lick it clean.
Feeling better, she turned back and looked at Arix gently. "Why are you still waiting at the door? Are you still scared? Don’t worry, the bad guys are gone."
Seeing Mama Tiger’s gentle demeanor, Arix felt a pang of sadness about their impending separation, and her eyes welled up with tears. But she remembered the Alliance and Thaddeus and Fleur waiting for her. Gathering her resolve, she said, "I’m sorry, Mama Tiger, I have to go."
"Go? No way! You’re my little one. How can you leave? You’re still so young; it’s too dangerous out there!" Mama Tiger said anxiously.
"Mama Tiger, I’m actually from the Alliance. My name is Arix Kering. I don’t know how, but I suddenly turned into a tiger cub. I have to go to the capital city to find the Pontifex and receive the Moon Goddess’s blessing to turn back into a human. Then I’ll return to the Alliance to find my real parents," Arix said firmly, looking into Mama Tiger’s eyes.
After hearing Arix’s story, Mama Tiger was silent for a long time. Finally, she raised a big paw and placed it on Arix’s head, saying sadly, "Do you really have to go? Can’t you stay?"
Arix shook her head, her voice resolute. "My parents are waiting for me, so I have to go back. They must be very worried about me now."
Mama Tiger lowered her paw and sighed, "Alright, wait here."
She walked out of the cave and let out a deafening roar. Soon, a tiger even larger than Mama Tiger appeared at the entrance. Daddy Tiger looked at Mama Tiger in confusion and asked, "What’s going on with our little one?"
Mama Tiger whispered with Daddy Tiger for a while. After he nodded, she came over, picked Arix up, and placed her on her back.
"The forest is still too dangerous. I’ll take you to the edge of the forest," she said gently to Arix.
"Okay, thank you, Mama Tiger," Arix replied, touched by the gesture.
Though Arix could leave the forest on her own, she wasn’t familiar with the terrain and would waste a lot of time. She was deeply moved that Mama Tiger, a Celesterror, was so considerate.
Thinking of those hunters who mercilessly hunted Celesterrors, a cold glint flashed in Arix’s eyes. She silently made a decision.
In the future, when she had the power, she would ensure the Empire’s Celesterrors were protected by law, just like in the Alliance, so they could live happily under the sun.
On the way out of the forest, Mama Tiger shared all the important things she knew with Arix.
She explained that the full name of the Empire was "the Empire of Sacred Moonlight," which had six major legions.
The first was the Werewolf Legion, directly under the royal family. Blessed by the Moon Goddess, werewolves had the purest bloodlines and were the strongest of the six legions.
The second was the Dragon Legion, led by dragonkins. Known as the warmongers of the Empire, they were powerful but troublesome, greedy, and stingy.
